job_title: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer - Top Secret Clearance
job_text: ['', ' Lead developer of distributed machine learning for applications which seek to detectemerging threats, forecast behaviors, and optimize related courses of action. T', ' Disseminating broad knowledge of analytics tools, applications and techniques. Develop applications which analyze data using descriptive, exploratory, predictive,explanatory, and prescriptive methods via automation using the latest machine learning, business intelligence, search, and intelligent data technologies.', 'Requirements', ' Create and modify applications using Java, distributed processing, and web technologies as part of a broader development team.', ' Leverage cloud services to feed multiple data sources into machine learning engines; coordinate the creation, validation, and use of models; integrate predictive results into application workflows; and support the interactions of userexperiences to meet customer requirements.', ' Lead developer of distributed machine learning for applications which seek to detectemerging threats, forecast behaviors, and optimize related courses of action. T Leverage cloud services to feed multiple data sources into machine learning engines; coordinate the creation, validation, and use of models; integrate predictive results into application workflows; and support the interactions of userexperiences to meet customer requirements. The developer will work within a broadersystem leveraging multiple distributed processing technologies like Spark, Knime, ElasticSearch, and Amazon Web Services. The developer will need to collaborate with data scientists, data integrators, application developers, and clients in driving innovation,communicating plans/possibilities, and overseeing delivery tasks on small agile teams. Disseminating broad knowledge of analytics tools, applications and techniques. Develop applications which analyze data using descriptive, exploratory, predictive,explanatory, and prescriptive methods via automation using the latest machine learning, business intelligence, search, and intelligent data technologies. Create and modify applications using Java, distributed processing, and web technologies as part of a broader development team. Research, design, develop, analyze, and modify Cloud-based enterprise-wide systems and applications software.', ' BS degree in CS, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or similar appliedquantitative discipline', ' The developer will work within a broadersystem leveraging multiple distributed processing technologies like Spark, Knime, ElasticSearch, and Amazon Web Services. The developer will need to collaborate with data scientists, data integrators, application developers, and clients in driving innovation,communicating plans/possibilities, and overseeing delivery tasks on small agile teams.', 'Responsibiliies', ' Research, design, develop, analyze, and modify Cloud-based enterprise-wide systems and applications software.']

['', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Perform validation of the production pipeline and document the validation results for regulatory purposes.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa01-2 years working in industry in a regulated environment, preferably in a clinical diagnostic laboratory', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Familiarity with open source bioinformatics tools and high-level programming skills (eg Python, R)', 'We are seeking a highly motivated\xa0Scientist, Bioinformatics Operations\xa0to join our Data Sciences team in Cambridge, MA.\xa0The Scientist will work closely with lab operations, product development and technology teams to oversee execution, validation and documentation of the production bioinformatics pipeline. The successful candidate will have knowledge of NGS methods development, strong analytical and technical skills and solid scientific background.', 'At Thrive, we are motivated to change the face of a cancer diagnosis. We challenge the status quo and are willing to think differently. Our curiosity drives us. There are countless questions related to cancer, and we flourish by finding solutions. We know what we do is important, and we take our work seriously. We also have fun. We do our work with vibrant energy, and we laugh out loud at the little things. This is How We Thrive.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Familiarity with version control systems and other software processes', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Self-motivated, with strong organizational skills, attention to detail and an ability to adapt to increasing opportunities and responsibilities as our team rapidly grows', '\xa0', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Develop methods to improve production process and debug and document process deviations. Create and maintain SOPs and other process documents.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Develop QC metrics relevant for analysis of production runs. Build queries, visualizations and reports from the patient sample data to share with cross functional teams.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience with cloud based development', 'Requirements and Qualifications', 'The Role', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Masters or equivalent with deep technical experience in bioinformatics and NGS data analysis', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Provide general bioinformatics support to the lab operations team.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Perform quality control analysis on data from multi-omics assays.', 'A cancer diagnosis is something no one wants to hear. Too often, cancer is detected late, once it has spread and treatment options are limited. But cancer can be more effectively treated with an intent to cure if caught in the earlier stages. At Thrive, an Exact Sciences Company, our goal is to transform this outlook: to catch cancer earlier, including several with no screening options today, to improve patient outcomes. We are developing a blood-based test that is designed to be affordable and utilized as part of routine medical care to detect multiple types of cancer at earlier stages. Our approach goes beyond a cancer diagnosis. We are developing a platform that will serve as a resource to help patients and their families maneuver the often confusing and overwhelming path that follows a cancer diagnosis.', 'Primary Responsibilities', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Develop a deep understanding of production bioinformatics pipeline and analyze any unexpected findings from the pipeline in patient sample data.']

['', 'Please Review The Following Job Description', ' As a Decision Scientist, focus on high impact, visible analyses and initiatives across multiple business models, covering banking channels, segments, and products, including but not limited to: Deposits, Operations, Small Business, Virtual Banking, Client Experience, Call Center, and Premier Banking.', ' Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education and 2+ years of experience in Banking, Finance, Decision/Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or Engineering.', ' Exercise sound judgment, risk management, and foster a client centric culture throughout design, development, and deployment practices.', ' Pursue business outcomes valued through increased revenue and/or efficiency leveraging data-driven insights powered by analytics in support of enhanced decision-making. Must be able to perform in a cross-functional and collaborative team environment focused on supporting business partners with enhanced insights. 3. Experience in delivering insights against tight deadlines in a collaborative environment to drive maximum impact. Ability to maintain a high level of competency in statistical and analytical principles, tools, and techniques. Incumbent should have an understanding of various database environments (IBM DB2, Oracle), technical programming skills (SAS, SQL, Toad), exposure to applied data science tools (R, Python, SAS E-Miner), familiarity with data visualization and BI tools (Tableau, MicroStrategy), and demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).', ' 4+ years of experience in Banking, Finance, Decision/Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or Engineering.', 'Should you have a disability and need assistance with the application process, please request a reasonable accommodation by emailing ', ' Ability to maintain a high level of competency in statistical and analytical principles, tools, and techniques.', ' or by calling 877-891-2510', 'Language Fluency: ', 'Work Shift', ' Must be able to perform in a cross-functional and collaborative team environment focused on supporting business partners with enhanced insights. 3. ['', '- Experience with open-source ELT tools such as Singer, dbt, and Meltano', 'About FIXD:', 'Description:', '- Strong SQL skills', '- Experience in DevOps infrastructure and/or AWS services', '- Evolve the data warehouse into a customer data platform able to answer questions about the complete customer journey', '- Maintain the infrastructure required to run pipelines, store and access the data', 'Qualifications:', "At FIXD, we take the stress and worry out of car problems. FIXD detects check engine lights and breaks them down into simple and understandable terms, so drivers don't get taken advantage of when they go to a repair shop. The FIXD Sensor plugs into the diagnostic port of a driver’s car and communicates via Bluetooth to the FIXD app.", '- Data Science or Machine Learning background, and associated tools (pandas, Jupyter, R)', '- Work with non-engineers to understand the questions and metrics and translate those needs into transforms of the data that answer questions', 'Nice to Have:', '- Build and monitor ELT pipelines using our open-source technology stack', 'The FIXD team is looking for a Data Engineer to help us create infrastructure to collect and analyze the data of our business. Being hypothesis- and metrics-driven in our decision-making is a core tenant of the culture of FIXD, and to do that effectively we need to be able measure those metrics.', 'Role:', '- Ability to communicate with non-technical stakeholders and translate between business concepts and data', '- Experience creating visualizations in Tableau', '- Comfort scripting in Python and working with external APIs', '- Experience in data warehouse technologies such as Snowflake or Redshift']

['', 'Preferred Qualification', 'Partner with Product and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities', 'Bachelors/Masters Degree with 4+ years (or PhD with 2+ years) of experience in the following areas:', 'Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, MATLAB)', 'Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our business products. Users include all forms of businesses, salespeople, developers, and morePartner with Product and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunitiesInform, influence, support, and execute our product strategy, decisions, and launchesThe Data Scientist Analytics role has work across the following four areas:Product Operations: Forecasting and setting product team goals, Designing and evaluating experiments and/or causal inference studies, Monitoring key product metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics, Building and analyzing dashboards and reports, We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.", 'We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We bring out the best in each other.', 'A BA/BS degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, or relevant data technology field, or equivalent professional work experience in software development, data engineering, data science or information technology2+ years of Python programming and scripting in a production environment2+ years of experience working with restful APIs and data modeling within SQL and NoSQL databases  Deep understanding of large-scale, distributed systems', 'A BA/BS degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, or relevant data technology field, or equivalent professional work experience in software development, data engineering, data science or information technology', '2+ years of experience working with restful APIs and data modeling within SQL and NoSQL databases  ', "Enterprising – and not defined by conventional roles. Our goal is to innovate, redefine, and break boundaries in expanding our modern data business. In Global Data's Technical Operations, our focus is on data engineering and how data is acquired, processed, validated and stored. We're constantly innovating to create better, more efficient systems to handle the huge variety of data we acquire and deliver to our clients.", 'Apply your coding skills: Automate the influx of data and build flexible solutions for data acquisition, ETL and machine learning pipelines, and human-in-the-loop data processing to drive successful product adoptionInspire and impact our business: Act as an internal consultant to influence and implement more efficient products through analysis, dashboards, web apps, and user documentationDevelop your career: sharpen your technical skills and strengthen relationships through project management, partnering with stakeholders across the firm, and establishing scalable architectureChampion improvements: identify strategic technical gaps in our ecosystem and advocate for solutions over workaroundsGrow our business: Approach each day knowing this role is mission-critical to the success of the firm. We will rely on your expertise, and our flat structure allows for you to make real impact, real quick', "Bloomberg is committed to diversity. It drives our innovation. At Bloomberg, you'll have the opportunity to go above and beyond and to take risks. You'll be a part of an organization that is entering new markets, launching new ventures, and pushing boundaries. Our ever-expanding array of technology, data, news, and media services champions innovation and empowers clients -- and offers nearly limitless opportunities for career growth.", 'Deep understanding of large-scale, distributed systems', 'Apply your coding skills: Automate the influx of data and build flexible solutions for data acquisition, ETL and machine learning pipelines, and human-in-the-loop data processing to drive successful product adoption', 'Grow our business: Approach each day knowing this role is mission-critical to the success of the firm. We will rely on your expertise, and our flat structure allows for you to make real impact, real quick', "At Bloomberg, our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Global Data, we're responsible for delivering this information through innovative technology - quickly and accurately.", "We see the impact of our work every day, whether it's using machine learning pipelines to estimate financial product data, architecting systems that guide decision-making, or finding ways for our colleagues to more easily do their jobs. We get to work with market data to detect anomalies, assess the quality of data feeds to evaluate the accuracy of forecasts, and figure out how to best combine system automation with a human touch, bringing value to our businesses and ultimately our clients.", '2+ years of Python programming and scripting in a production environment']

job_title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Content Platform
job_text: ['', 'Have a strong background in Data Science and Machine Learning, with experience and expertise in designing, building, and testing models.', "What You'll Do", 'Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and improving Spotify’s products by the means of hands-on ML development.Collaborate with a cross-functional agile team spanning data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that improve the quality of our catalog.You will own the model design and keep the team aligned with ML-infrastructure while maintaining a focus on impact and delivery.Prototype new ML approaches and production-ize solutions at scale.Perform data analysis to establish baselines and inform product decisions.Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners across Spotify.', 'Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners across Spotify.', 'Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and improving Spotify’s products by the means of hands-on ML development.', 'Experience with building data pipelines and getting the data you need to build and evaluate your models, using tools like Apache Beam / Spark is a plus.', 'You will own the model design and keep the team aligned with ML-infrastructure while maintaining a focus on impact and delivery.', 'Experienced with data pipeline tools like Apache Beam, Scio, etc. and cloud platforms like GCP or AWS.', 'Have hands-on experience implementing production machine learning systems at scale in Java and Scala or similar languages.', 'Experienced with Java microservices that will contribute to backend development and help guide the team towards standard methodologies with our machine learning solutions.', 'You care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and responsible experimentation.', 'Have a strong background in Data Science and Machine Learning, with experience and expertise in designing, building, and testing models.Have hands-on experience implementing production machine learning systems at scale in Java and Scala or similar languages.Experienced with frameworks such as Tensorflow and the Tensorflow ecosystem (TFX) is also a plus.Experienced with data pipeline tools like Apache Beam, Scio, etc. and cloud platforms like GCP or AWS.Experienced with Java microservices that will contribute to backend development and help guide the team towards standard methodologies with our machine learning solutions.Experience with building data pipelines and getting the data you need to build and evaluate your models, using tools like Apache Beam / Spark is a plus.Have familiarity with reinforcement learning approaches is a huge plus.Experienced in a production environment and has proven the ability to deliver results making tradeoffs between idealistic approaches and product impact.You care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and responsible experimentation.', 'Collaborate with a cross-functional agile team spanning data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that improve the quality of our catalog.', 'Have familiarity with reinforcement learning approaches is a huge plus.', 'Experienced with frameworks such as Tensorflow and the Tensorflow ecosystem (TFX) is also a plus.', 'Who You Are', 'Prototype new ML approaches and production-ize solutions at scale.', 'Experienced in a production environment and has proven the ability to deliver results making tradeoffs between idealistic approaches and product impact.', 'Perform data analysis to establish baselines and inform product decisions.']

job_text: ['', 'Advanced quantitative degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.5 years of relevant professional experience.Experience in sport psychology, habit formation, and user engagement a plus.', 'Ability to execute on and give feedback in multiple data environments involving complex joins, data cleaning, and feature creation using SQL or SQL based languages (Hive).', 'Demonstrated skill set to work with analytics toolkits on large data sets.', 'Able to quickly pick up new programming languages, technologies, and frameworks.', 'Prior experience synthesizing and packaging complex analyses and delivering results to non-technical audiences including senior leadership teams.', 'Qualifications:', 'Excellent communications skills, in particular, the ability to communicate technical content to general audience in presentation and meeting format.', 'Experience working with real-world, structured and unstructured data.', 'Experience in sport psychology, habit formation, and user engagement a plus.', 'Core mathematical ability to apply state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and/or statistical modeling in a programming language like R or Python to understand patterns and provide insights is required.', 'Hive', 'Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment and to multi-task across different functions of the business, and switch workstreams and handle many different levels of requests.', 'Advanced quantitative degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.', 'As a Senior Data Scientist, you will join a team of data scientists that are embedded within the Engagement and Activity product teams. You will further the data science and analytics strategy, working to drive measurable impact in multiple classifications of business success.\xa0', 'Has a strong problem solving and analytical mindset.The ability to think creatively with data, formulate and get tractions around new ideas, and bring a new perspective to business and engineering partners.Implementation experience in digital optimization, A/B and multivariate test implementation, analysis and business reviews.Able to influence and communicate effectively, both verbally and written, with team members, business stakeholders and leadership.Experience working with real-world, structured and unstructured data.Ability to execute on and give feedback in multiple data environments involving complex joins, data cleaning, and of applied data science.Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment and to multi-task across different functions of the business, and switch workstreams and handle many different levels of requests.', 'Python', 'Implementation experience in digital optimization, A/B and multivariate test implementation, analysis and business reviews.', '5 years of relevant professional experience.', Due to the rapid growth of their Data Science team, we are looking to hire a Senior Data Scientist across their Research and Analytics team.', 'SQL', 'Skills:', 'In-depth background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field.', 'Has a strong problem solving and analytical mindset.', 'Are you ready to make a career-altering difference in driving one of the world’s largest fitness brands to new digital heights?', 'R', 'In-depth knowledge of applied data science.', 'The ability to think creatively with data, formulate and get tractions around new ideas, and bring a new perspective to business and engineering partners.', 'Able to influence and communicate effectively, both verbally and written, with team members, business stakeholders and leadership.']

['', 'Responsibilities:', 'Set up automated and ad-hoc analysis to efficiently extract patterns, correlations, and insights from rich transaction data, operations data, usage data, and third party data to help optimize feature/SKU adoption, customer retention strategies, and R&D priorities.\xa0\xa0', 'This position reports to the Director of Product Management - Product Adoption.', 'Analyze and interpret advanced statistical and ML models to provide fast and easy access to quality data and insights for the product organization to become a seamless part of the product development lifecycle enabling smarter decision-making, more efficient product development, and greater innovation.', 'The Product Adoption team in our Product organization is actively looking for a seasoned, highly technical and mission-driven Senior Data Scientist to define & build models to analyze customer usage and other data and provide insights that enable data-driven product development and decision making at Workday.\xa0 This is an exciting cross-functional role where you will work in partnership with a variety of stakeholders including but not limited to Product, Engineering, Technology, Design, Community, Services, Solution Marketing, and Solution Management to empower them with data-driven actionable insights.\xa0 You will uncover insights, identify opportunities for product improvements and new product development, define product metrics with goals, and design experiments that drive adoption and engagement of Workday’s products and help grow the business.\xa0 You will execute key data science initiatives and drive the requirements to identify, explore, evaluate, and analyze new data sets for key insights to continuously improve adoption.\xa0\xa0', 'Strong project management skills and experience with agile/scrum\xa0', '\xa0', 'Collaborate directly with the Internal Product Analytics team to provide requirements for statistical & predictive models that inform business strategy for cross functional stakeholders and have expert knowledge of advanced modeling applications and when to apply what algorithm for each unique business problem.', 'BA/BS in a quantitative field - computer science, engineering, statistics, operations research,\xa0 business analytics, economics, finance, or related field.\xa0 Advanced degree is a plus.\xa0', 'Experience in SaaS cloud industry and/or Technology companies/industry preferred\xa0', 'Customer centric approach. The analysis you do is in support of solving customer problems, and you are driven to improve our customers’ experiences.', 'Experience in designing, developing, and maintaining data science, analytics AI, and machine learning models and capabilities', '8+ years of hands-on machine learning, advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and/or data science experience covering areas such as supervised/unsupervised learning, ensembles, time-series data analysis, forecasting modeling, neural networks, and NLP', 'Track record of delivering data-driven actionable insights that influence strategic decision making and program development.\xa0', 'Experience on AWS stack (Redshift, Sagemaker), scripting languages (Python and R) and BI platforms (Tableau)', 'This role will work directly with the Internal Product Analytics team to build the requirements & plan for metrics, data sets, and analytic models and act as the adoption insights subject matter expert. \xa0 The successful Workday’s world class Product organization.\xa0 The ideal person should be a hands-on, analytic problem solver, relentless in execution, and passionate about building models and insights that enable a culture of experimentation and data-driven product development.\xa0', '\u200b', 'Communicate actionable insights effectively to all levels of the organization, including executives.\xa0 Act as the ['', 'Requirements include:', 'We are looking for someone who will be able to work on-site and in the office once things are back to normal. 5-10% travel is possible. Midwest location. This role will work closely with top executives across the company to deliver Data Science-based operational and business solutions designed to accommodate continued corporate expansion. This is a strategic role so we are looking for a business-oriented/operations Data Scientist who can conceptualize, develop and deliver end-to-end product/business solutions to the business stakeholders (this is not a modeling job). Insurance industry experience is a must. A background in consulting is a big plus as this role is seen as a valued business partner and advisor.\xa0\xa0', '- Experience working with large, complex data', '- Experience developing presentation decks and presenting', '- Working side by side with top executives to develop a full understanding of the division/department including pain points, challenges, process improvement opportunities, and automation opportunities. job_text: ['', ' Data Science (70% of your time): Utilize a wide variety and resources and techniques to create NLP and forecasting models to help us predict customer behavior and engagement. ['', 'We are looking for a Hadoop Administrator to administer and manage Hadoop clusters and other Hadoop ecosystem resources for our Fortune 500 client. This fast-paced, high visibility initiative will integrate data across internal and external sources, provide analytical insights, and integrate with the customer’s critical systems. The Hadoop administrator may also perform DBA-like tasks with HBase, Hive and other NoSQL databases, as well as security administration and cluster administration.', 'Solution and deadline oriented.', 'Ability to communicate and coordinate across various teams.', 'Deploy and administer Kafka Cluster, Topics, Kafka Connect, ksqlDB, and integrations to schema registry.', 'Install and configure Apache Atlas and/or Cloudera Navigator for scanning Hadoop databases, Spark/Sqoop/Storm codebases, to render technical data lineage.', 'In-depth knowledge of Hadoop ecosystem, preferably Hortonworks or CDP (HDFS, Yarn, Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Spark, Hive, Zookeeper, Oozie, Hbase/Impala etc).', 'Comfortable challenging your peers and leadership team.', 'Create, manage SSL certificates, and enable HTTPs ', 'Strong knowledge of Unix/AIX and Windows operating systems, standard concepts, practices, and procedures within the relational database field.', 'Benefits:\xa0Excellent health benefits, Matching 401K, and education reimbursement.', 'Must have 5+ years of Data Sytems/Warehouse/Lakes/Equivalent sytem experience with multiple OS platforms.', 'Strong analytical and problem solving skills.', 'Requirements:', 'Pipeline data using Cloud or on-premises technologies: AWS Big Data Services, Hadoop, HDFS, AI/Deep Learning API’s, SQL/NOSQL, Unstructured Databases, etc.', 'The position is responsible for constructing and optimizing our data lake and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. Incumbent is expected to be experienced as a data pipeline builder and a data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data-analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. Individual must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives. ['', 'Once you apply, we’ll send you the full job spec, all company information and a highlight of their leadership team.', 'Our CONFIDENTIAL, pre-IPO, venture-backed, growth client is hiring a Data Engineer who will tackle hard challenges everyday! Using a mix of the latest-and-greatest tech as well as proven tools to pioneer the use of data discovery, pipelining, extraction, importation, sanitization, and visualization of massive datasets to an industry that is eager to utilize an Enterprise SaaS solution in their daily workflow. You will take on tough problems in machine learning and scalable data processing using technologies like Scala, Spark, Postgres, ElasticSearch and Docker.']

job_title: Machine Learning Engineer, Remote Sensing Imagery
job_text: ['', 'Clearance eligibility', 'Clearance eligibility: An Active TS/SCI Security clearance is required, or ability to gain clearance eligibility is required.', 'An Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.', '3+ years of industry experience working with frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, JAX, or Keras for tasks such as object detection, semantic segmentation, or generative modeling (GANs, Autoencoders) or using those frameworks to deploy models based on the same tasks.', 'Prioritize getting the system working, but know when it is right to take on technical debt.', 'Rebellion is a well-capitalized technology start-up firm that is passionate about defining and delivering modern, life-changing software products to the US Department of Defense (DoD), the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD), and their allies. At Rebellion we believe in operating what we own, we deliver all of our products as managed services, this allows our product teams to maintain operational ownership across all deployments. Expect talented, motivated, intense, and interesting co-workers.', 'At Rebellion, we use science and math to empower and support our war fighters. Our team is a close-knit team of multi-disciplinary software engineers and researchers responsible for applying models that detect signals in the vast amounts of noisy data that the Department of Defense consumes. The team works on projects with a geospatial component that involve things like CV entity detection, generative models, synthetic data, and simulation across sensor types such as SAR, EO, IR, and LIDAR across all domain operations.', "Own problems end-to-end, and are willing to pick up whatever knowledge you're missing to get the job done.", "Have an advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g. computer science, statistics/data science, physics, or math).3+ years of industry experience working with frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, JAX, or Keras for tasks such as object detection, semantic segmentation, or generative modeling (GANs, Autoencoders) or using those frameworks to deploy models based on the same tasks.Demonstrate strong experience in Python or GoLang.Understand and enjoy working with remote sensing technologies and spatial analysis to manipulate, extract, and analyze geospatial data from satellites and aircraft.Are interested in the current SOTA for generative models such as GANs and Variational Autoencoders.Are self-directed, detail-oriented, and enjoy figuring out the most important problem to work on.Own problems end-to-end, and are willing to pick up whatever knowledge you're missing to get the job done.Prioritize getting the system working, but know when it is right to take on technical debt.", 'Understand and enjoy working with remote sensing technologies and spatial analysis to manipulate, extract, and analyze geospatial data from satellites and aircraft.', 'In this role, you will work on a product team to use state of the art techniques and create new techniques to deliver insights across sensor types. You will also work with other ML engineers to close the gap among products by identifying opportunities for shared models or services. The goal is to provide timely intelligence during strategic Department of Defense missions and their adoption and success will ensure the safety of both civilians and service members.', 'Build and own the full-stack for the solution provided.', 'Work on and with the product team to identify problem areas where AI/ML is a potential solution.Build or incorporate SOTA models in focus areas such as object detection, semantic segmentation, and data generation (synthetic data, generative models) across multiple domains, incorporating the geospatial component where applicable.Build and own the full-stack for the solution provided.Partner and build shared solutions with Geospatial team members and the broader AI/ML teams for cross cutting capabilities.', 'Rebellion Defense is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. Rebellion Defense does not discriminate against applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability, or any other protected characteristic in accordance with federal, state, and local law.', 'You May Be Fit For This Role If You', ': An Active TS/SCI Security clearance is required, or ability to gain clearance eligibility is required.', 'Demonstrate strong experience in Python or GoLang.', 'Are interested in the current SOTA for generative models such as GANs and Variational Autoencoders.', 'Are self-directed, detail-oriented, and enjoy figuring out the most important problem to work on.', 'Have an advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g. computer science, statistics/data science, physics, or math).', 'Partner and build shared solutions with Geospatial team members and the broader AI/ML teams for cross cutting capabilities.', 'Work on and with the product team to identify problem areas where AI/ML is a potential solution.', 'Build or incorporate SOTA models in focus areas such as object detection, semantic segmentation, and data generation (synthetic data, generative models) across multiple domains, incorporating the geospatial component where applicable.', 'We are seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with remote sensing experience in the Seattle, Washington Office.', 'Compensation includes meaningful equity ownership, competitive salaries, full medical coverage, disability and life insurance, and transit reimbursement.', 'What You’ll Do']

['', 'Specialized Experience', 'GS-13: ', 'GS-12: ', 'Basic Requirements\xa0', 'This Direct-Hire position is in the Food and Drug Administration and is located in the Center for Tobacco Products (CTP), Office Science (OS), Division of Population Health Science (DPHS) located in Beltsville, Maryland.', 'Participates in the development of policy associated with providing or presenting information on current trends in social science.', 'NOTE: Applicants must submit all relevant transcripts that demonstrate you possess the required education to meet the Basic Qualifications.', '(A) ', 'Minimum Qualifications', '(B) You have a combination of education and experience that provided you with knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field.', "The Center for Tobacco Products (CTP) of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is responsible for implementing the Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act. This law gives FDA authority over tobacco products by adding a new chapter to the Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act. The Tobacco Control Act gives FDA the authority to regulate tobacco products and manufacturers based on the best available science and CTP is responsible for both assessing and fostering that science-base. CTP's actions have significant public health and consumer protection impact, and are among the most important issues faced by the Agency in its long and distinguished history.", 'Responsibilities/Job Duties', 'Open/Close Date: 02/25/2021 to 03/03/2021', 'Qualifications', 'Job Vacancy link: https://www.usajobs.gov/GetJob/ViewDetails/593257600', '(A) You have a degree in behavioral or social science; or related disciplines appropriate to the position.', '(B)', 'Participates in research related to the communication of information about tobacco products such as labeling, advertising, promotion and marketing.', 'GS-12: Have one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-11 grade level in the Federal service which includes assisting in obtaining data and research to assist in developing consumer surveys to evaluate consumer perceptions, intention and/or use of products that could be applied to tobacco or other regulated products.', 'Specialized Experience. Specialized experience is experience that equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform successfully the duties of the position, and that is typically in or related to the work of the position to be filled.', 'Summary', 'In addition to meeting the basic qualifications for the Social Scientist, positions, you must also meet the following:', '(C) ', '12/13, you must meet the following:', 'Prepares reports on research results for supervisors, peers, professional societies and industry meetings.', 'Only applications submitted via USAJOBS at the link below along with appropriate supporting documentation, including transcripts, will be considered:', '(C) You have four years of appropriate experience that demonstrated that you have acquired knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field.', 'Participates in research related to the communication of information about tobacco products such as labeling, advertising, promotion and marketing.Reviews, analyzes, evaluates, consults and measures outcomes of data obtained in studies designed to investigate comprehension, judgment, knowledge and behavior related to tobacco product labeling and/or advertisements.Prepares reports on research results for supervisors, peers, professional societies and industry meetings.Participates in the development of policy associated with providing or presenting information on current trends in social science.Develops and maintains contacts within professional and scientific organizations.', '-or-', 'The position of Social Scientist falls under the 0101 occupational series. To qualify for this position at grade GS', 'The position of Social Scientist falls under the 0101 occupational series. To qualify for this position at grade GS-12/13, you must meet the following:', 'GS-13: Have one year of specialized experience, equivalent to the GS-12 grade level in the Federal service, which includes designing and developing research protocols and conducting research on consumer perception, intention and/or use of products that could be applied to tobacco or other regulated products.', 'Reviews, analyzes, evaluates, consults and measures outcomes of data obtained in studies designed to investigate comprehension, judgment, knowledge and behavior related to tobacco product labeling and/or advertisements.', 'Develops and maintains contacts within professional and scientific organizations.', 'Social Scientist\xa0GS-0101012 - 13\xa0']

job_title: Translational Data Scientist-Senior Expert I - Translational Medicine
job_text: ['', 'Minimum Requirements', ' Provide subject matter expertise for high-dimensional clinical data (genetics, genomics, digital, and/or imaging) and analysis solutions to inform patient stratification and enrichment strategies', 'Company/Legal Entity', ' Conceive, design, and execute exploratory analyses as Lead Data Scientist across Phase I-III clinical trials, applying advanced analytical approaches as required Participate in and lead cross-functional biomarker collaborations with Discovery and Development partners to support target selection and registration activities Provide subject matter expertise for high-dimensional clinical data (genetics, genomics, digital, and/or imaging) and analysis solutions to inform patient stratification and enrichment strategies Work expeditiously with matrixed clinical trial teams with diverse membership and expertise', ' Strong grasp of human genetics and molecular epidemiology, including genomic approaches, technologies, and analytic techniques to inform clinical trial design and enrichment, e.g. GWAS/RVAS/PheWAS.', ' Strong understanding of biostatistics and machine learning, including longitudinal analysis and signal processing.', ' The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.', ' Participate in and lead cross-functional biomarker collaborations with Discovery and Development partners to support target selection and registration activities', 'Functional Area', 'Shift Work', ' Conceive, design, and execute exploratory analyses as Lead Data Scientist across Phase I-III clinical trials, applying advanced analytical approaches as required', ' Advanced knowledge of statistical programming in R. Working experience with Python or similar scripting programming language a must', 'Work Location', ' PhD or MD or equivalent experience in statistical genetics, bioinformatics, biostatistics, computational biology, machine learning, data science or related field Three or more years of experience in analyzing large biological datasets in a drug discovery/development or relevant academic setting - MS w/3-5 years of relevant experience Advanced knowledge of statistical programming in R. ['Necessary Qualifications:\xa0', 'We know that innovation thrives on product teams where diverse points of view come together to solve hard problems in ways that are just now possible. As such, we explicitly seek people that bring diverse life experiences, diverse educational backgrounds, diverse cultures, and diverse work experiences.\xa0', 'Our\xa0product managers that are not afraid of signing up for results, even when this means they\xa0must\xa0work through others to achieve the necessary results.\xa0You will need to be able to influence your teammates, as well as colleagues, stakeholders, and key executives, through your use of data and logic.\xa0', 'Our\xa0product teams solve hard problems – customer problems and business problems – in ways that our customers love\xa0and\xa0yet work for our business. Our product teams are cross-functional and durable, generally comprised of a product manager, a product designer, and several engineers.\xa0', 'Demonstrated understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and product delivery.\xa0', 'We staff our product teams with the skills necessary to come up with effective solutions that are\u202fvaluable\u202f(our customers choose to buy or use),\u202fviable\u202f(the solution works within the many constraints of the business),\u202fusable\u202f(the user can figure out how to use) and\u202ffeasible\u202f(our engineers have the skills and technology to implement).\xa0', 'Diverse Perspectives:', 'Demonstrated ability to figure out solutions to hard problems with many constraints, using sound judgement to assess risks, and to lay out your argument in a well-structured, data-informed, written narrative.\xa0', '\xa0', 'Necessary Qualifications:', 'Bachelor’s degree.\xa0Demonstrated understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and product delivery.\xa05\xa0years working on technology-powered products as either a product manager, product designer, engineer, data analyst, data scientist, or user researcher.\xa0Demonstrated ability to figure out solutions to hard problems with many constraints, using sound judgement to assess risks, and to lay out your argument in a well-structured, data-informed, written narrative.\xa0Proven ability to engage with engineers, designers, and company leaders in a constructive and collaborative relationship.\xa0', 'feasible', 'We look for product managers that understand that consistent innovation is the result of each member of the product team contributing their passion and their ideas. The product manager must collaborate closely with her product designer and engineers to discover effective solutions, and then work together to deliver those solutions to market.\xa0', 'viable', 'Proven ability to engage with engineers, designers, and company leaders in a constructive and collaborative relationship.\xa0', 'Diverse Perspectives:\xa0', 'Our\xa0product manager must contribute to\xa0their\xa0product team a solid knowledge of the various constraints of the business – constraints from marketing, sales, service, finance, legal, and privacy are typical examples. The product manager must also contribute to the product team a deep knowledge of our users and customers, and the data about how our customers engage with our products. Finally,\xa0our\xa0product managers\xa0are\xa0expected to track industry trends and the competitive landscape as they pertain to her product.\xa0', '5\xa0years working on technology-powered products as either a product manager, product designer, engineer, data analyst, data scientist, or user researcher.\xa0', 'Bachelor’s degree.\xa0', 'valuable', 'usable']

['', 'Sr. Research Scientist/Engineer – Text Detection/Recognition', '• Experience in deploying deep learning algorithms on mobile platforms', 'Requirements', '• Seek scientific solutions to highly ambiguous problems by crafting a technical vision and building consensus across teams', '• Strong track record of Android development.', '• Devise ways to extract information from images beyond just text: document structure and flow, font and styling information, logos and tables', '• Experience with at least one of the deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Caffe, and MXNet.', '• Identify benchmark datasets relevant to different industries and use-cases and work towards production-quality performance on them', '• Publications in top tier international conferences and journals, such as CVPR/ECCV/ICCV/NeurIPS/ICLR/PAMI/IJCV, etc.', 'Preferred Qualifications:', '• Strong background in smartphone architecture.', 'Duties and responsibilities', '• Develop, evaluate, improve, optimize, and deploy our advanced models, such as text detection/recognition, layout analysis, table analysis, page detection, field extraction, font analysis, etc.', '• Strong mathematical foundation in machine learning and deep learning.', '• Strong programming skills in Python, C/C++, Java, etc.', "Looking to make an impact in the future using your AI knowledge? This position aims to use latest deep learning/machine learning methods to build the world's best text detection and recognition techniques. Our fast-growing team will provide users a more convenient life with strong technology products. And we are looking for a Research Scientist/Engineer to build our next generation online and offline version. You will deal with different types of data and use the latest modules and invention ideas to develop a high-performance detection/recognition model.", '• Experience in quantization/acceleration for deep learning models.', '• Track record of developing demanding deep learning algorithms and applications.', '• PhD degree or MS degree with 3~5 years of professional experience in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statics, Mathematics or equivalent.', 'Job purpose', 'As a Senior Research Engineer focusing on advanced text detection/recognition and image processing, you will be responsible for developing and improving deep learning and computer vision models. Your work will give you an opportunity to work across teams: working with the engineer team to deploy the models on the cloud or mobile devices, working with customer team to prioritize improvements based on real world feedback, and working with our front-end team to craft end-user apps that best show off your work.', '• Experience in developing deep learning algorithms for object detection and recognition, etc.', 'Your roles:']

job_title: Senior Research Scientist, Machine Learning/Reinforcement Learning
job_text: ['', 'Who We Are', 'You will have the chance to lead and guide the development of certain research directions.', 'Nuro is a robotics start-up whose mission is to accelerate the benefits of robotics for everyday life. We have an elite team of entrepreneurs and engineers, designers, and scientists. We believe AI and robotics are at the cusp of transforming daily life and we are dedicated to building meaningful products with this technology. Join us and play a critical role in our mission.', 'You have critical thinking to tackle challenging research problems, are resilient to failure, and have a passion to deploy the solutions into the product.', 'You will have the flexibility to publish to top-tier conferences and deploy models in our product.', "Our software team is growing and we are looking for machine learning R&D experts to join us. Machine Learning is an essential cornerstone of the work we do and you'll be making a massive impact. Our founders have dedicated their careers to machine learning and robotics so you would be working alongside them and some of the other brightest minds from academia and industry in this field.", 'You will research and develop advanced machine learning algorithms that solve complex problems to dramatically accelerate autonomy deployment.', 'About the Work', 'Nuro is an equal opportunity employer and expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.', 'You have an advanced degree (Ph.D. preferred) in Machine Learning or Computer Science (or other related fields) or have seasoned industry experience in related fields.', 'You are an adept programmer and can write high-quality code (C++ preferred).', 'You are a quick learner, a hard worker, and a good team player.', 'You will collaborate closely with talented team members across the autonomy org.', 'About the Role', 'You will research and develop advanced machine learning algorithms that solve complex problems to dramatically accelerate autonomy deployment.You will have the chance to lead and guide the development of certain research directions.You will have the flexibility to publish to top-tier conferences and deploy models in our product.You will produce robust, well-tested, and scalable C++ software.You will collaborate closely with talented team members across the autonomy org.', 'You have the experience of leading or managing a few people to work on and solve complex problems.', 'You have deep expertise and prior experience in some or many of the following areas: machine learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, generative modeling, etc.', 'You have the experience of leading or managing a few people to work on and solve complex problems.You have deep expertise and prior experience in some or many of the following areas: machine learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, generative modeling, etc.You have critical thinking to tackle challenging research problems, are resilient to failure, and have a passion to deploy the solutions into the product.You are a quick learner, a hard worker, and a good team player.You are an adept programmer and can write high-quality code (C++ preferred).You have an advanced degree (Ph.D. preferred) in Machine Learning or Computer Science (or other related fields) or have seasoned industry experience in related fields.', 'About You', 'You will produce robust, well-tested, and scalable C++ software.']

['', 'Display a high level of critical thinking in bringing success to the organization', 'Programming experience with data sets in Python, Scala, Java or C#', 'Experience with data replication tools (Attunity, DeltaLake, or Hudi)', 'Display a high level of critical thinking in bringing success to the organizationInfluence technical solutions while coaching newer or less experienced members on your Scrum teamConstruct and manage services which extract data from disparate databases, transform the data and loads into a Snowflake data warehouseCollaborate with team members on best practices, code reviews, internal tools and process improvementsEvangelize new ideas within your team as well as across teamsDevelop high performing, scalable and secure solutionsPlan and deliver core technology upgradesDiagnose, design, and implement solutions to key technology or application problems', 'A history of taking applications from conception/design to implementation/support', 'Must be an effective communicator\xa0', 'High energy, confident, ambitious and self-motivated individual', 'As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be a technical leader in a collaborative team environment that encourages you to perform at your best, while contributing to the engineering efforts of one of our data scrum teams. You will be challenged to engineer right-sized solutions for complex business problems focused on building patterns to support data pipelines, data warehousing, and data transformations. You will apply your knowledge of modern software design, best practices, design patterns, and frameworks, with an understanding of application performance and maintainability. ['', 'Email Address: hr@bpsbioscience.com', 'Location: San Diego, CA', 'Description: Description/Key Responsibilities: BPS Bioscience Inc. is a leading provider of recombinant proteins, assay kits, and recombinant cell lines for drug discovery. We are seeking an exceptional scientist, with a strong background in enzymology, enzyme kinetics, protein/protein interactions, and fluorescence and luminescence-based assays. This successful candidate will be responsible for enzyme characterization, enzymatic assay development, protein/protein interaction assays, and assessing enzyme inhibitor potency and mode of inhibition mechanism.\xa0', 'Minimum Requirements', 'Email Address: ', 'Area(s) of expertise desired: Enzymology ', 'Required education: Ph.D. ', 'Position type:', 'Description', 'Position type: Full Time', 'Minimum Requirements: A Ph.D. degree in Biochemistry, Biophysics, Molecular Biology, Cell Biology, or a related field is required. The candidate must have proven experience performing enzyme kinetics and assay optimization. ['', ' Build and lead the data engineering practice area at Hummingbird. Ensure data is viewed as a first class entity in all product, architecture, and strategy discussions. Identify and ingest third-party data sources from public sources and external vendors to augment our data in a way that eases compliance workflows for our customers.  Architect an infrastructure that can scale with our business. Facilitate data science work both internally at Hummingbird and for our customers. Provide the infrastructure, features, and analytics to support machine learning development. Work closely with team members in Engineering, Product, Design, Sales, and Regulatory to understand customer and compliance requirements and define roadmaps for better data practices into our product solutions. Build and maintain scalable data pipelines, ETLs and other infrastructure to structure data and make it available for analysis and model training. Shadow customers when possible to build empathy for their problems, understand their workflows, and build user experiences that best support their needs. Review the plans and work of other engineers on the team for use in your practice area as well as general maintainability, performance, and correctness. Seek out and evaluate new libraries and vendors that compliment our technology. Work with other senior members of the team to shape the culture of the Hummingbird engineering to be productive, inclusive, and welcoming. ', 'AWS, Heroku', 'Technologies We Use And Teach', 'PostgreSQL, Redis', " You've previously integrated common data sources for financial information. job_title: Senior Researcher (Mixed Methods and Quantitative Focus)
job_text: ['', 'We are seeking a Senior Researcher with expertise in mixed methods to join our team. The successful candidate will be a part of FrameWorks’ research team and investigate how to effectively reframe a wide range of social and scientific issues, such as affordable housing, poverty, education equity, and climate change. This is an outstanding opportunity for a mid-career professional with experience in social science research and a demonstrated commitment to equity and social change.', 'Move FrameWorks’ research process forward by developing new methods, helping us refine our theory, and contributing new ideas about effective framing strategies.', 'Resume or CV with complete employment history and educational background', 'Effective communication is a key part of bringing about social change and helping the public to better understand society’s greatest social problems. Strategic framing can help us all see the solutions to those problems and build the collective will to support them. That’s what we do at the FrameWorks Institute — a nonprofit, progressive think tank that designs, conducts, interprets and translates communications research to advance social justice.', 'Please submit the following materials to jobs@frameworksinstitute.org, using the subject header line Senior Researcher Spring 2021:', 'Ability to analyze and interpret qualitative data', 'About FrameWorks', 'The ideal candidate will possess:', 'Experience in identifying the implications of social science research for applied questions', 'Compensation and Benefits', 'Analyze and interpret research findings to generate applied communications recommendations', 'The Senior Researcher will collect, analyze, and synthesize multiple streams of quantitative and qualitative data to produce framing recommendations for advocates, experts, and scientists working to engage the public about policy solutions to social issues. They will present FrameWorks’ research to different audiences and contribute to the organization’s efforts to engage communicators across multiple nonprofit sectors. They will also help develop and innovate FrameWorks’ methods and theory.', 'A solid background and broad training in social science research (relevant disciplines include anthropology, sociology, linguistics, psychology, cognitive science, political science, and communications)', 'It applies rigorous social science methods to study how people understand social issues and develops evidence-based techniques for explaining those issues more effectively. Since 1999, it has conducted pioneering research on effectively communicating a wide variety of scientific and social issues, such as early childhood development, climate change, and immigration.', 'Track record of producing high-quality, timely analytic research products for non-academic audiences', '\xa0', 'Key responsibilities', 'Develop deep knowledge of Strategic Frame Analysis®, FrameWorks’ mixed-methods approach to generating and applying innovative communications strategies.Move FrameWorks’ research process forward by developing new methods, helping us refine our theory, and contributing new ideas about effective framing strategies.Lead the design and analysis of survey experiments that test the frame effects of communications tools, such as values and metaphorsCollect and analyze data from individual interviews, focus groups, media content, and advocacy communicationsAnalyze and interpret research findings to generate applied communications recommendationsWrite and present research findings in a variety of formats and styles suitable for different audiences', 'Strong mixed methods research skills, with particular expertise in quantitative methods (e.g. survey sampling and experimental design)', 'The FrameWorks Institute is a nonprofit think tank that helps mission-driven organizations communicate in ways that build public will to support progressive change.', 'Knowledge of applied inferential statistics (crosstab reports, multiple regression, factor analysis, cluster analysis) and analysis software (e.g. R)', 'Ability to distill and interpret complex research findings for non-academic audiences', 'Exceptional organizational and time-management skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced organization and get things done; practical judgment to move work forward; flexibility and ability to adapt to changing needs', 'Review of all applications will begin immediately and continue until the search process concludes. Please check FrameWorks’ website (www.frameworksinstitute.org) to ensure the position is still available before applying. No solicitations, please.', 'Please submit the following materials to jobs@frameworksinstitute.org, using the subject header line Senior Researcher Spring 2021. Please do not use Easy Apply to apply for this position.', 'Collect and analyze data from individual interviews, focus groups, media content, and advocacy communications', 'In 2015, it was named one of nine organizations worldwide to receive the MacArthur Foundation’s Award for Creative and Effective Institutions. Learn more at\xa0www.frameworksinstitute.org.', 'To apply:', 'Experience in quantitative methods and research design (e.g., experimental surveys)', 'A solid background and broad training in social science research (relevant disciplines include anthropology, sociology, linguistics, psychology, cognitive science, political science, and communications)Experience in applied research settings, non-profit organizations, narrative change/communications, or other related fields (e.g. community organizing, market research, journalism)Experience in quantitative methods and research design (e.g., experimental surveys)Experience with some form of qualitative research (e.g., conducting and analyzing interviews or focus groups)Experience in identifying the implications of social science research for applied questionsTrack record of producing high-quality, timely analytic research products for non-academic audiencesDemonstrated commitment to social justice and equity. Expertise on issues relating to racial equity is particularly sought after.', 'Ability to absorb and apply a wide range of existing social science theory and methods to data analysis and interpretation', 'Ability to apply an equity lens to research (e.g. analysis of coded language in interviews and focus groups).', 'Develop deep knowledge of Strategic Frame Analysis®, FrameWorks’ mixed-methods approach to generating and applying innovative communications strategies.', 'Up to three writing samples – a mix of styles, genres, and audiences is a plus', 'Outstanding ability to design research to answer applied communications questionsStrong mixed methods research skills, with particular expertise in quantitative methods (e.g. survey sampling and experimental design)Knowledge of applied inferential statistics (crosstab reports, multiple regression, factor analysis, cluster analysis) and analysis software (e.g. R)Ability to analyze and interpret qualitative dataAbility to integrate qualitative and quantitative findingsAbility to absorb and apply a wide range of existing social science theory and methods to data analysis and interpretationAbility to apply an equity lens to research (e.g. analysis of coded language in interviews and focus groups).Ability to distill and interpret complex research findings for non-academic audiencesStrong writing and presentation skills; ability to present to audiences without social science backgroundsAbility to work effectively in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary, partner-oriented settingExceptional organizational and time-management skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced organization and get things done; practical judgment to move work forward; flexibility and ability to adapt to changing needs', 'Demonstrated commitment to social justice and equity. Expertise on issues relating to racial equity is particularly sought after.', 'Lead the design and analysis of survey experiments that test the frame effects of communications tools, such as values and metaphors', 'This is a full-time position based in Washington, DC. The position requires up to 30% travel under standard circumstances (due to Covid, all data collection, presentations, and workshops will be conducted virtually until at least Fall 2021).', 'Ability to integrate qualitative and quantitative findings', 'Cover letter explaining your interest in the position, its relevance to your career goals and your past experience, as well as where and how equity and social justice fit into your professional and/or academic experiences', 'Experience in applied research settings, non-profit organizations, narrative change/communications, or other related fields (e.g. community organizing, market research, journalism)', 'Write and present research findings in a variety of formats and styles suitable for different audiences', 'Experience with some form of qualitative research (e.g., conducting and analyzing interviews or focus groups)', 'Skills needed', 'FrameWorks Institute is committed to equity, diversity, and inclusion. Applications from BIPOC, women, persons with disabilities, and people who identify as LGBTQIA are strongly encouraged.', 'Resume or CV with complete employment history and educational backgroundCover letter explaining your interest in the position, its relevance to your career goals and your past experience, as well as where and how equity and social justice fit into your professional and/or academic experiencesUp to three writing samples – a mix of styles, genres, and audiences is a plus', 'Experience required', 'Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary, partner-oriented setting', 'We are a team of social scientists and strategists with diverse backgrounds and a wide array of professional experiences. The ideal candidate is someone who is intellectually curious, creative, insightful, informed about contemporary policy issues, committed to realizing social justice and equity, and has strong conceptual and analytical skills.', 'Strong writing and presentation skills; ability to present to audiences without social science backgrounds', 'The salary band for this position starts at $80,000. At every level within the organization’s personnel structure, FrameWorks’ salaries are competitive with similar nonprofits of our size. FrameWorks values its staff and offers a comprehensive benefits package including generous medical insurance, vacation, and family leave benefits; retirement benefits and life insurance; optional pre-tax salary deductions for childcare, medical, and transportation expenses; options for occasional telework; and more.', 'Outstanding ability to design research to answer applied communications questions']

['', 'Who We Are', 'Oasis Systems has an exciting opportunity for a Cloud Data Engineer to support the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) in Washington, DC. The contractor will assist the CFTC in standing up their new Amazon Web Services (AWS) platform and will lead the design and implementation of various data products in AWS with a focus on automation, reusability and creating value from data.\xa0', 'Leveraging Spark and PySpark to transform and pipe data sets across AWS.', 'CERTIFICATIONS:\xa0', 'SECURITY CLEARANCE: ', 'EDUCATION:\xa0Bachelor’s degree ', 'EDUCATION:\xa0', 'Performing ad hoc data analysis including financial modeling, Value at Risk (VaR) modeling, and Machine Learning.', '\xa0', 'SECURITY CLEARANCE: Ability to pass a Special Agreement Check (SAC) and a National Agency Check and Inquires (NACI) Background Investigation ', 'DESCRIPTION: ', 'LOCATION:\xa0Washington, DC\xa0', ' EXPERIENCE LEVEL: A minimum of 3 years of experience developing cloud-based applications that enable data automation, management and reporting. Highly experienced with data manipulation and transformation. Experience in Finance a plus.\xa0\xa0', 'DESCRIPTION: Functionally, the candidate will be responsible for:', 'Creating documentation as required under the PMLC and the Configuration Change Board (CCB) in order to move projects to the production environment.', 'Designing and developing Python-based applications in AWS to handle the ingest, management and testing of agency data.', 'Cloud Data Engineer', 'Building a variety of real-time reports using Python, Plotly and DASH and handling all aspects of the software development lifecycle, with specific focus on data quality and validation.', ' EXPERIENCE LEVEL', 'Ideating, designing and building forward-thinking machine learning and anomaly-detection solutions in the context of AWS and Sagemaker.', 'LOCATION:\xa0', 'Designing and developing Python-based applications in AWS to handle the ingest, management and testing of agency data.Developing and executing plans to migrate existing data products/assets into AWS, with the known-how and energy to disassemble and re-architect complex, macro-driven data processes.Leveraging Spark and PySpark to transform and pipe data sets across AWS.Ideating, designing and building forward-thinking machine learning and anomaly-detection solutions in the context of AWS and Sagemaker.Building a variety of real-time reports using Python, Plotly and DASH and handling all aspects of the software development lifecycle, with specific focus on data quality and validation.Performing ad hoc data analysis including financial modeling, Value at Risk (VaR) modeling, and Machine Learning.Creating documentation as required under the PMLC and the Configuration Change Board (CCB) in order to move projects to the production environment.Participating in facilitated meetings between stakeholders at CFTC which may include regular status meetings, user acceptance testing meetings and ad hoc development discussions.', 'DESCRIPTION', 'Developing and executing plans to migrate certification a plus.', 'Participating in facilitated meetings between stakeholders at CFTC which may include regular status meetings, user acceptance testing meetings and ad hoc development ['', 'Casual working environment', 'Highly Competent with Scala, Spark, the Spark Engine, and the Spark Dataframe API', 'Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)', '100% paid short-term and long-term disability', 'Flexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary', 'Become intimately familiar with the medicare claims data model', 'Candidate must reside in the United States', 'Spark, Scala, Hadoop, Python, and AWS EMR', 'Physical and emotional requirements for the job', 'GSuite, Slack, Jira, Confluence, Git, and Github', 'This position is to be performed remotely from an individual’s home office and involves sedentary work. Employees in this role can be expected to exert up to 10 pounds of force on occasion in order to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move standard electronic equipment. Employees are expected to make decisions in a timely manner and display emotional intelligence during occasional stressful situations.', 'Spark, Scala, Hadoop, Python, and AWS EMRTerraform, Jenkins, Airflow, and AWS Step FunctionsJupyter and ZeppelinAWS S3, AWS Redshift, AWS ECS, AWS SQS and TeradataGSuite, Slack, Jira, Confluence, Git, and Github', 'Responsibilities', 'Three weeks of PTO', 'Minimum of 5 years relevant work experience\xa0', 'Experience in a technical leadership role', 'Build scalable data processing pipelines in SparkDebug Spark jobs and do performance tuningWrite unit and integration tests for all data processing codeWork with DevOps engineers on CI, CD, and IaCRead specs and translate them into code and design documentsPerform code reviews and develop processes for improving code qualityBecome intimately familiar with the medicare claims data model', '100% paid life insurance', 'If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact 703-787-9656 x257 or HR@semanticbits.com for assistance.', 'SemanticBits is a leading company specializing in the design and development of digital health services, and the work we do is just as unique as the culture we’ve created. We develop cutting-edge solutions to complex problems for commercial, academic, and government organizations. The systems we develop are used in finding cures for deadly diseases, improving the quality of healthcare delivered to millions of people, and revolutionizing the healthcare industry on a nationwide scale. There is a meaningful connection between our work and the real people who benefit from it; and, as such, we create an environment in which new ideas and innovative strategies are encouraged. We are an established company with the mindset of a startup and we feel confident that we offer an employment experience unlike any other and that we set our employees up for professional success every day.', 'Required Qualifications', 'Excellent command of written and spoken English', 'Read specs and translate them into code and design documents', 'Ten paid holiday days', 'Experience with Agile methodology, using test-driven development', '401k retirement plan with matching benefit', 'Bachelor’s degree required in Computer Science or related fieldMinimum of 5 years relevant work experience\xa0Highly Competent with Scala, Spark, the Spark Engine, and the Spark Dataframe APIExperience in a technical leadership roleExperience with Agile methodology, using test-driven developmentExcellent command of written and spoken EnglishCandidate must reside in the United StatesFlexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary', 'Write unit and integration tests for all data processing code', 'You will work on projects that support the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) as we develop a next-generation analytics and reporting system that directly impacts healthcare quality. You will use Spark to build data processing pipelines that derive information from large sets of government data. You will be the go-to on your team for Spark, the Spark Engine, and the Spark Dataframe API. You will take a proactive approach in learning new technologies in distributed processing and cloud computing to pilot PoC for new development. We are a collaborative company, so we want you to use your knowledge of Spark to teach others, inform design decisions, and debug runtime problems.', 'Perform code reviews and develop processes for improving code quality', 'Jupyter and Zeppelin', 'Tools & Technology', 'Debug Spark jobs and do performance tuning', 'Flexible working hours', 'SemanticBits, LLC is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are also a veteran-friendly employer.', 'Benefits', 'Competitive salary', 'Terraform, Jenkins, Airflow, and AWS Step Functions', 'Comprehensive health benefits (medical with HSA option, dental, and vision)', 'AWS S3, AWS Redshift, AWS ECS, AWS SQS and Teradata', 'Bachelor’s degree required in Computer Science or related field', 'SemanticBits is looking for a talented Lead Senior Data Engineer who is eager to apply industry experience in computer science, software engineering, databases, and distributed/parallel processing frameworks to prepare big data for the use of data analysts and data scientists while providing guidance, and mentorship to a team of developers. In this role you will drive contract initiatives to completion in a split role as a technical lead, team architect (IaC), and policy liaison with leadership and stakeholders. You will work closely with other technical leads on cross functional teams to solve challenging data delivery problems. You will advocate for best practices and technical debt reduction to streamline processing and reduce maintenance costs / cloud footprint. If you have experience with Scala and Spark and want your work to contribute to systems that collect healthcare data used by hundreds of thousands of daily users, we want to (virtually) meet you!', 'Work with DevOps engineers on CI, CD, and IaC', 'Build scalable data processing pipelines in Spark']
