job_title: Distinguished RD Staff National Security Sciences Data Science and Analytics
job_text: ['Demonstrated ability to write winning proposals to government agencies in the area of national security.', 'Initiate, lead and perform independent and impactful R & D on an ongoing basis as evidenced by, for example, innovative S & T delivered to sponsors, successful proposals, S & T presentations, professional community engagement, inventions/patents/copyrights, publications as appropriate, etc.', 'Develop a vision and implement a cohesive research strategy to ensure the success of new and ongoing research projects to position the group for future success.', 'Lead by example to ensure all work is carried out safely, securely, and in compliance with ORNL policies, standards, and procedures.', 'Experience working for or collaborating with DOE National Laboratories (or similar R & D organizations). Special Requirement: This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a clearance from the Department of Energy. As such, this position is a Workplace Substance Abuse (WSAP) testing designated position. WSAP positions require passing a pre-placement drug test and participation in an ongoing random drug testing program. This position will remain open for a minimum of 5 days after which it will close when a qualified candidate is identified and/or hired. We accept Word (.doc, .docx), Adobe (unsecured .pdf), Rich Text Format (.rtf), and HTML (.htm, .html) up to 5MB in size. Resumes from third party vendors will not be accepted; these resumes will be deleted and the candidates submitted will not be considered for employment. If you have trouble applying for a position, please email . ORNL is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans, are encouraged to apply. UT-Battelle is an E-Verify employer.', 'Demonstrated ability to make significant technical contributions to projects.', 'Exemplify a commitment to excellence in research, operations, and community engagement, and work cooperatively to leverage scientific capabilities across ORNL.', 'Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated leadership ability and a strong commitment to a team environment.', 'Demonstrated track record of research and development leadership in national and/or international engagements that seek to sustain and strengthen the national security community.', 'Requires a Ph.D. with a minimum of 12 years relevant experience or a M.S. with a minimum of 16 years relevant experience in computer science, mathematics, or related field.', 'Lead program development activities through sponsor engagements, preparation of proposals and white papers, participation in workshops, as well as other program development activities.', 'Demonstrated ability to present scientific results to sponsors and technical communities, we well as at professional society conferences and workshops.', 'Advance the reputation of the group and standing of the group as a whole through establishing collaborations, professional society leadership and involvement, and organization of technical events. Basic Requirements:', 'Develop and implement plans to exploit new opportunities and/or expand existing efforts.', 'Strong written and oral communication skills. Preferred Qualifications:', 'Lead by example by exercising scientific integrity in proposing, performing, and communicating research.', 'Demonstrated ability to successfully lead national security projects as principal investigator.']

['', 'Why you should quit your job right now and join this organization!', 'The Hired Guns are seeking a passionate User Experience Researcher to support the core UX team at one of the most sought-after global technology companies. This full-time freelance opportunity will start out remotely, then post-COVID will move on-site in NYC, Austin, the Bay Area, Seattle, or Munich, Germany.', 'The Nitty Gritty', 'Looking to add a heavy-hitting company to your resume that can unlock your future opportunities in the tech space? This is it. You will never be bored working as a UX Researcher at this omnipresent brand. You’ll have resources aplenty (including the backing of a super-talented team) and limitless opportunities for growth. While you’ll be well supported, the role is relatively self-managed. As a member of a new team within a highly-coveted company, you will have an opportunity to get in on the ground floor of new research initiatives.', 'You’re someone who works collaboratively and cross-functionally with designers, product managers and engineers. Along with speed, you have a deep knowledge of accessibility and strong familiarity with heuristics, prototype evaluation, and assumption mapping.', 'You’ll master the balance of providing rapid research with supporting ongoing core foundational work, while easily pivoting from project to project and keeping several initiatives in the air at once. (Let’s just say “multi-tasker” is an understatement.)', 'A focus on DEI (diversity, equity, inclusion) is core to your research approach, and you always keep accessibility in mind. In your current role, you are moderating or designing end-to-end research. Bonus if you have a background in anthropology, human-centered design, psychology, cognition, or sociology.', 'This organization—a leader in the fields of UX and research—is building a brand new UX Research team devoted to collecting user feedback for new application and feature development and updates. As a User Experience Researcher, you’ll work alongside designers and engineers, helping them create internal-facing applications and tools for over 200,000 employees. (If history is any guide, some of these projects may later become globally-used external applications!)', '\ufeffThe Hired Guns does not and will not discriminate in considering and referring candidates for employment, or in its treatment or advancement of its employees, and will not tolerate harassment, on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including gender identity and expression), sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law.', 'The Inside Skinny', 'You have at least one year of usability study experience at a large technology brand and a track record of delivering clear research insights. Having reported to various stakeholders (engineering, product managers, designers), you’re comfortable managing projects and working on a lean, agile team. You’re totally confident with presenting to business stakeholders and audiences who are less versed in user research.', 'Why You?', 'The backstory on the organization and why they need to hire you!', 'How you’ll know if you’re a fit…']

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.', 'Runtime verification and runtime monitoring;', 'Job ID: TYARD952373 ', 'Research prototype development skills.', 'Knowledge of programming and scripting languages, e.g., Java, Python, etc.', 'Company Background: ', 'Knowledge of computer systems, embedded systems, and systems and software engineering.', ' Research on High-Assurance Connected Software Architecture &Software Engineering including: Contract-based architecture, contract-based design, formal contract languages; Automatic formal verification; Runtime verification and runtime monitoring; Correctness-by-construction; Automatic abstraction (bottom-up) and decomposition (top-down) of system specifications. job_text: ['', 'Knowledge of advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) and/or Machine Learning (ML) ', 'Experience working in a UNIX environment with advanced scripting languages', 'Good oral and written communication skills in English', ' (please indicate in your cover letter). ', 'Demonstrated skill in performing tasks requiring organization and attention to detail.', 'Provide support for currently assimilated infrared and microwave radiances for operational application at NCEP.', 'Experience in working with HPC platforms (MPI, OpenMP, Slurm, LSF, etc.)', 'I.M. Systems Group', 'Overview', ' Apply ', 'Advanced knowledge of radiative transfer and experience with radiative transfer modeling for data assimilation, such as the Community Radiative Transfer Model (CRTM) or Radiative Transfer for TOVS (RTTOV)', 'Experience in model development in various infrastructures like the Earth System Modeling Framework (ESMF) and NOAA Environmental Modeling System (NEMS)', 'Knowledge of data assimilation with focus on the satellite radiance assimilation for numerical weather prediction. ', ' Candidates must be a U.S. Citizen or Green Card Holder to qualify ', 'Design, setup, and execute impact assessment and pre-implementation testing to facilitate possible transition to operations', 'Leveraging externally developed AI algorithms and techniques to improve the selection and integration of satellite based observations.', 'Job ID: ']

job_title: Senior Principal Research Scientist and Center Director of the Biomedical Research Informatics
job_text: ['', 'Design, conduct, and publish original research in peer reviewed journals.', 'Undertake independent and collaborative research, including the development of new data analytic procedures. ', 'Supervise staff of the laboratory; ensure that staff receive adequate training.', 'Prioritize projects; ensure accuracy of design and analysis, interpretations and that deadlines are met. Serve on designated department committees and work groups.', 'Qualifications', 'A comprehensive CV and detailed Cover Letter are required in order for your application to be considered.***Essential FunctionsCo-manage BRIC , liaise, as appropriate, with department leadership. hospital divisions and other research laboratories and with other hospital and community physicians and scientistsUndertake independent and collaborative research, including the development of new data analytic procedures. Design, conduct, and publish original research in peer reviewed journals.Actively pursue external funding by initiating grant applications as PI and collaborating in submission of grant applications with others.Supervise staff of the laboratory; ensure that staff receive adequate training.Ensure the facility meets all regulatory requirements; update policies and procedures as appropriatePrepare and manage the annual laboratory budget; identify equipment needs; submit facility activity reports as required.Prioritize projects; ensure accuracy of design and analysis, interpretations and that deadlines are met. Serve on designated department committees and work groups.Obtain appropriate academic appointments with the University of Delaware or Thomas Jefferson University Medical School, or both, and maintain professional development plan.QualificationsPhD in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or related field with a concentration in machine learning focused on biomedical informatics, computational biology, or bioinformatics required.Demonstrated experience in machine learning using deep neural networks and related technologies as applied to biomedical informatics and/or bioinformatics.Demonstrated success in conceiving, directing, and obtaining grant funding for projects in these areas.Experience with Unix/Linux command shells, job scheduling systems for high performance computing, programming with Python, R, MatLab, or other scientific programming languages.Our dedication to professionals who are dedicated to children frequently earns Nemours a spot on the list of top workplaces in the communities we serve. Our Associates enjoy comprehensive benefits, including our unique “Bridge to a Healthy Future” pediatric health plan, an integrated wellness program, opportunities for professional growth, and much more. As an equal opportunity employer, Nemours focuses on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.', 'Prepare and manage the annual laboratory budget; identify equipment needs; submit facility activity reports as required.', 'PhD in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or related field with a concentration in machine learning focused on biomedical informatics, computational biology, or bioinformatics required.Demonstrated experience in machine learning using deep neural networks and related technologies as applied to biomedical informatics and/or bioinformatics.Demonstrated success in conceiving, directing, and obtaining grant funding for projects in these areas.Experience with Unix/Linux command shells, job scheduling systems for high performance computing, programming with Python, R, MatLab, or other scientific programming languages.', 'Experience with Unix/Linux command shells, job scheduling systems for high performance computing, programming with Python, R, MatLab, or other scientific programming languages.', 'Actively pursue external funding by initiating grant applications as PI and collaborating in submission of grant applications with others.', 'Our dedication to professionals who are dedicated to children frequently earns Nemours a spot on the list of top workplaces in the communities we serve. Our Associates enjoy comprehensive benefits, including our unique “Bridge to a Healthy Future” pediatric health plan, an integrated wellness program, opportunities for professional growth, and much more. As an equal opportunity employer, Nemours focuses on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.', 'Obtain appropriate academic appointments with the University of Delaware or Thomas Jefferson University Medical School, or both, and maintain professional development plan.', 'Ensure the facility meets all regulatory requirements; update policies and procedures as appropriate', 'Co-manage BRIC , liaise, as appropriate, with department leadership. hospital divisions and other research laboratories and with other hospital and community physicians and scientists', 'Co-manage BRIC , liaise, as appropriate, with department leadership. hospital divisions and other research laboratories and with other hospital and community physicians and scientistsUndertake independent and collaborative research, including the development of new data analytic procedures. Design, conduct, and publish original research in peer reviewed journals.Actively pursue external funding by initiating grant applications as PI and collaborating in submission of grant applications with others.Supervise staff of the laboratory; ensure that staff receive adequate training.Ensure the facility meets all regulatory requirements; update policies and procedures as appropriatePrepare and manage the annual laboratory budget; identify equipment needs; submit facility activity reports as required.Prioritize projects; ensure accuracy of design and analysis, interpretations and that deadlines are met. Serve on designated department committees and work groups.Obtain appropriate academic appointments with the University of Delaware or Thomas Jefferson University Medical School, or both, and maintain professional development plan.', 'As one of the nation’s leading pediatric health care systems, Nemours is committed to providing all children with their best chance to grow up healthy. We offer integrated, family-centered care to more than 300,000 children each year in our pediatric hospitals, specialty clinics and primary care practices in Delaware, Florida, Maryland, New Jersey and Pennsylvania. Nemours strives to ensure a healthier tomorrow for all children – even those who may never enter our doors – through our world-changing research, education and advocacy efforts. At Nemours, our Associates help us deliver on the promise we make to every family we have the privilege of serving: to treat their child as if they were our own. ', 'Essential Functions', 'PhD in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or related field with a concentration in machine learning focused on biomedical informatics, computational biology, or bioinformatics required.', 'Demonstrated success in conceiving, directing, and obtaining grant funding for projects in these areas.', 'Senior Principal Research Scientist and Center Director of the Biomedical Research Informatics Center (BRIC)', 'Equity, diversity, and inclusion guide our growth and strategy. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about, and committed to leading efforts to provide culturally relevant care, reducing health disparities, and helping build a diverse and inclusive team environment. All Nemours associates are expected to ensure that these philosophies are embedded in their day to day work with colleagues, patients and families. ', 'Demonstrated experience in machine learning using deep neural networks and related technologies as applied to biomedical informatics and/or bioinformatics.']

['', 'Responsibilities:', 'Work with a multidisciplinary team consisting of human geneticists, bioinformaticians and software engineers to lead the design, execution, and interpretation of in silico human genetic studies', 'Provide genetic intelligence on therapeutic targets of interest for external collaborators', 'Your responsibilities will include using human genetics data to identify new therapeutic targets in order to advance Empirico’s drug discovery and development pipeline. You will be expected to:', 'Familiarity with the design of functional studies to understand the mechanistic basis for genetic associations', 'Core background MUST be in computational genetics; this position is NOT for scientists with a primarily wet-lab backgroundA firm understanding of the principles of statistical genetics and genetic epidemiologyDemonstrated ability to design, lead and interpret human genetics studies and to discern therapeutic hypothesesFamiliarity with the design of functional studies to understand the mechanistic basis for genetic associationsApplicants must have authorization to work in the U.S.', 'Survey the latest developments in the broader genetics community and incorporate relevant approaches and findings into internal studies', 'Position Description:', 'Applicants must have authorization to work in the U.S.', 'Translate findings from genetic studies into therapeutic hypotheses and contribute to decisions around therapeutic modality and targeting strategies', 'Demonstrated ability to design, lead and interpret human genetics studies and to discern therapeutic hypotheses', 'This position requires an MD or PhD with at least 4-6 years of postgraduate experience in human genetics research with a translational focus. Pay and title commensurate with experience', 'Discover novel genetic associations with human diseases using Empirico’s world-leading target discovery platform', 'Collaborate with biologists and chemists on the design of in vitro and in vivo experiments to validate therapeutic hypotheses that are motivated by human genetics findings', 'Create and deliver expert-level presentations that clearly communicate genetic discoveries and stories to colleagues, collaborators and investors', 'A firm understanding of the principles of statistical genetics and genetic epidemiology', 'Provide novel ideas and critical thinking for the continued development and improvement of Empirico’s target discovery platform', 'Empirico is a venture-backed, next-generation therapeutics company founded on utilizing huge biological datasets, human genetics and programmable biology to power novel target discovery and development. Empirico’s Precision Insights Platform was purpose-built for therapeutic discovery and leverages a world-leading dataset and advanced algorithmic approaches to identify and prioritize therapeutic targets with a high probability of translational success. High priority therapeutic targets are experimentally validated in-house prior to progressing through pre-clinical development with the most optimal therapeutic modality. Empirico is headquartered in San Diego, CA with laboratories in Madison, WI.', 'Work with a multidisciplinary team consisting of human geneticists, bioinformaticians and software engineers to lead the design, execution, and interpretation of in silico human genetic studiesDiscover novel genetic associations with human diseases using Empirico’s world-leading target discovery platformProvide genetic intelligence on therapeutic targets of interest for external collaboratorsCreate and deliver expert-level presentations that clearly communicate genetic discoveries and stories to colleagues, collaborators and investorsTranslate findings from genetic studies into therapeutic hypotheses and contribute to decisions around therapeutic modality and targeting strategiesCollaborate with biologists and chemists on the design of in vitro and in vivo experiments to validate therapeutic hypotheses that are motivated by human genetics findingsProvide novel ideas and critical thinking for the continued development and improvement of Empirico’s target discovery platformSurvey the latest developments in the broader genetics community and incorporate relevant approaches and findings into internal studies', 'Empirico is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.', 'To all agencies: Please do not contact any employee of Empirico about this position. All resumes submitted by agencies to any employee of Empirico via-email or in any form and by any method will be deemed the sole property of Empirico, unless such agencies were engaged by Empirico for this position and a valid agreement is in place.', 'Requirements:', 'Core background MUST be in computational genetics; this position is NOT for scientists with a primarily wet-lab background', 'Position Description: Empirico, an early-stage biotechnology company, is looking for a director-level computational geneticist experienced in analyzing and interpreting large scale human genetics data for the purpose of therapeutic target discovery. This is an excellent opportunity for a highly-motivated, creative scientist to be a vital member of a team of experts dedicated to identifying new disease targets and translating those insights into therapeutic programs.']

['', 'The learning objectives and goals for this opportunity include', 'Participant will expand their understanding of design requirements for high-pressure, detonation based combustion systems.', 'Must have good oral and written skills to enable communication of the research to the scientific and technical communities.', 'The initial appointment is for one year, but may be renewed upon recommendation of NETL contingent on the availability of funds. The participant will receive a monthly stipend commensurate with educational level and experience.\xa0The appointment is full-time at NETL in Morgantown, WV.\xa0This is an educational opportunity offered by NETL and administered by the Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education.\xa0Participants in the program are not considered employees of DOE or the program administrator.', '\xa0Participant will expand their understanding of state-of-the-art, high-speed combustion and flow diagnostics.\xa0In particular, quantification of chemiluminescence in relation to chemical reactions and chemi-ionization', 'Participant will expand their understanding of conducting state-of-the-art research for power generation systems.', 'The National Energy Technology Laboratory currently has an educational opportunity for a postgraduate researcher to explore state-of-the-art power generation systems through its program in Pressure Gain Combustion (PGC) at its research campus in Morgantown, WV.\xa0PGC through detonation technologies such as Rotating Detonation Engine (RDE) offers the potential for significant efficiency gains when used as a replacement for conventional constant pressure combustion in a Gas Turbine Engine or Direct Power Extraction. The postgraduate researcher will assist in the development and testing of multiple lab-scale Rotating Detonation Combustion technologies and state-of-the-art diagnostics.\xa0The candidate will have the opportunity to assist with design and modification of experimental components of the RDC test facilities, experimental design and testing, and perform detailed analysis of time dependent measurements (pressure, temperature, ion, thin-film heat flux) as well as digital image processing and advanced laser diagnostics (i.e. Tunable Diode Laser Absorption Spectroscopy). Relevant concepts include shock wave dynamics, high speed fluid dynamics, jet mixing, combustion, heat transfer, mechanical design, data acquisition / instrument control and laser diagnostics.\xa0The candidate will also have the opportunity to participate in the preparation and presentation of technical papers and reports both internally and through internationally recognized publications and venues.', 'Knowledge in experimental combustion and fluid mechanics, heat transfer and thermodynamics, specifically with application to highly dynamic environments.\xa0\xa0', "To be eligible, you must have received a Master's degree within the last three years or a doctoral degree within the last five years.", 'The ideal candidate will have some, but not necessarily all, of the following skills:', 'Knowledge in experimental combustion and fluid mechanics, heat transfer and thermodynamics, specifically with application to highly dynamic environments.\xa0\xa0Knowledge of experimental data acquisitions using commercial software applications such as National Instruments LabView is required.\xa0Knowledge and experience with analysis and reduction of experimental data including image processing is desirable using Mathworks MATLAB or Python.\xa0\xa0Must have good oral and written skills to enable communication of the research to the scientific and technical communities.', 'Knowledge and experience with analysis and reduction of experimental data including image processing is desirable using Mathworks MATLAB or Python.\xa0\xa0', 'Participant will expand their understanding of quantifying the strength of detonation waves and the extent of detonation versus deflagration.', 'Knowledge of experimental data acquisitions using commercial software applications such as National Instruments LabView is required.\xa0', 'Participant will expand their understanding of how to design and apply state-of-the-art laser diagnostics, such as Tunable Diode Laser Absorption Spectroscopy as a diagnostic for high-pressure detonation based combustion to quantify product gas species and operating conditions.', '\xa0Participant will expand their understanding of state-of-the-art, high-speed combustion and flow diagnostics.\xa0In particular, quantification of chemiluminescence in relation to chemical reactions and chemi-ionizationParticipant will expand their understanding of quantifying the strength of detonation waves and the extent of detonation versus deflagration.Participant will expand their understanding of design requirements for high-pressure, detonation based combustion systems.Participant will expand their understanding of how to design and apply state-of-the-art laser diagnostics, such as Tunable Diode Laser Absorption Spectroscopy as a diagnostic for high-pressure detonation based combustion to quantify product gas species and operating conditions.Participant will expand their understanding of conducting state-of-the-art research for power generation systems.']

['', 'https://medicine.musc.edu/departments/otolaryngology/research/hearing', 'How to Apply/Contact: ', 'Charleston is a city of approximately 500,000 in the metro area and contains three undergraduate campuses (College of Charleston, Citadel, and Charleston Southern) and MUSC. The city is accordingly youthful, with a large district containing bars, pubs, and excellent restaurants. \xa0Charleston has been voted as America’s Best Tennis Town, and is also the artistic center of South Carolina, with the annual Spoleto Arts Festival a three-week display of local and international artistic and musical talent. \xa0Charleston is surrounded by water, and beaches are within 20 min of downtown.\xa0', 'https://www.linkedin.com/in/hainan-lang-78331248/', 'Duties: ', 'Qualifications: ', 'Duties: Potential research projects involve work in animal models of sensory impairment and postmortem human nervous tissue to better understand age-related auditory dysfunction and neurodegenerative disorders. ', 'How to Apply/Contact: \xa0Please submit a current CV and a 2-3 page description of research interests and career goals to Hainan Lang, M.D., Ph.D. (langh@musc.edu).', 'https://medicine.musc.edu/departments/neuroscience)', 'The University: ', 'https://medicine.musc.edu/departments/pathology/research/laboratories/lang', 'Qualifications: We encourage highly qualified and motivated individuals with a PhD from a broad array of backgrounds relevant to auditory neuroscience and neurodegenerative diseases, including but not limited to cellular and molecular biology, genetics, immunology, cell and gene therapy, and regenerative medicine to apply. The ideal candidate will have an excellent record of research experience and expertise in molecular biology and/or neuroscience. The proposed research provides opportunities for training across a broad range of topics, including neurobiology, immunology, electrophysiology, and stem cell biology related to neural systems. ', 'The Department of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine at the Medical University of South Carolina (MUSC), in Charleston, S.C., invites applications for a Postdoctoral Fellow Position. ', 'The University: MUSC (containing colleges of Medicine, Graduate Studies, Dentistry, Pharmacy, Nursing and Health Professions) is located in beautiful downtown Charleston, South Carolina. \xa0MUSC is home to a strong group of scientists working on various basic and applied questions related to neurodevelopmental and neurodegenerative disorders. \xa0The training environment offers numerous opportunities to collaborate with investigators in a nationally recognized center of neuroscience research and a well-established, and multi-disciplinary P50 Clinical Research Center for the study of age-related hearing loss (supported by NIDCD since 1987) at MUSC. ']

['', 'Be a customer advocate, helping to ensure teams have a clear picture of the end user experience.', 'Ability to manage a research project from end-to-end including eliciting stakeholder goals, study design, screener development and recruiting management, test moderation, data analysis and reporting', ' The role will primarily be focused on working closely with a small team of content, design, and product specialists, conducting research to inform development of one of our B2B applications. Apply experience, knowledge of social science, design, and ecommerce best practices to identify both tactical and programmatic research needs. Define testable hypotheses that are relevant to the business and design approaches to address general user experience and product marketing questions. Develop research plans and recruitment criteria with stakeholder input. Collect research data using a broad range of methods (e.g. moderating interviews, usability, focus groups, contextual evaluations, diary studies; design and program surveys) directly, in collaboration with other research staff, or using vendors. Present findings and implications (from a single study or a combination of multiple studies and/or data sources) to stakeholder audience. Work closely with various stakeholders (e.g. product, design, development) to produce high quality, innovative designs that leverage research insights. Be a customer advocate, helping to ensure teams have a clear picture of the end user experience. Investigate and socialize new technology, processes, and/or research approaches. ', ' 5+ years UX research experience, ideally a mix of B2B and B2C. Experience using a variety usability methods for both remote and in-person research, including: card sorting, heuristic evaluation (formal and informal), cognitive walkthroughs, participatory design / co-creation workshops Ability to manage a research project from end-to-end including eliciting stakeholder goals, study design, screener development and recruiting management, test moderation, data analysis and reporting Strong written, verbal, and presentation skills Ability to support multiple simultaneous projects and product teams  BA/BS in related field; job_text: ['', ' Exposure of IT Operations Architecture', ' Should have an experience of any time-series database (Influx DB, Cortex)', ' We are looking for a Technical Lead who can design and build the data integration process for capturing and integrating logs, metrics, traces from systems and applications for a command center.', ' Good to have an experience of distributed tracing using Zipkin or Jaeger', ' Should have an experience of data processing using Kafka', ' Experience in design/implementation with distributed applications', 'Additional Technical Skills:', ' Good understanding of architecture disciplines including business, applications, infrastructure, storage, security, platforms, data, analytics, networking on-premise and in a cloud environment', 'Mandatory Technical Skills:', ' The command center will serve as an advanced decision support center with real time visibility into the entire enterprise application operations, data and infrastructure monitoring.', 'Job Requirements', ' We are looking for a Technical Lead who can design and build the data integration process for capturing and integrating logs, metrics, traces from systems and applications for a command center. The command center will serve as an advanced decision support center with real time visibility into the entire enterprise application operations, data and infrastructure monitoring. Should have an experience of any time-series database (Influx DB, Cortex) Should have an experience of data processing using Kafka Should have an experience of designing and building Java/python based custom connectors for fetching operation details from applications. Good to have an experience of distributed tracing using Zipkin or Jaeger Exposure of IT Operations Architecture Experience in design/implementation with distributed applications Good understanding of architecture disciplines including business, applications, infrastructure, storage, security, platforms, data, analytics, networking on-premise and in a cloud environment', ' Should have an experience of designing and building Java/python based custom connectors for fetching operation details from applications.']

['', "Mentor undergraduate and graduate students working in the lab with respect to their own research areas. Help students find the resources they require, whether that be physical lab equipment or administrative/financial resources. Help students by providing advice and assistance in research and education needs.Other duties as assigned.Required QualificationsA PhD in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field is required.1 or more years' of related/transferable experience is required.This position requires strong analytical, technical, and writing skills.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Strong knowledge on various RF system design such as RF passive components, PLL, VCO, and antenna design from UHF RFID to mmWave for 5G.Experience with RF spectrum a", "Perform research and technical tasks for grants that have been awarded. Ensure that the relationship with collaborative entities such as other universities and industrial partners remains effective by maintaining knowledge about lab research tasks and personnel to make the proper connections between researchers in the lab and at the collaborator's institution. Ensure projects progress on track in accordance with the proposed timeline at time of award.System Administration", 'Help perform lab administration duties such as lab supply and equipment procurement, equipment management, grant paperwork (including pre-award submissions, post-award budget management, and progress report preparation).Proposal Writing', 'Help manage the lab anechoic chamber, reverberation chamber, and ceiling mounted Software Defined Radio grid network consisting of radio nodes, reconfigurable antennas, RFID readers, a large wireless channel emulator, and their associated computers and servers. Help ensure close to 100% uptime on the grid network for research continuity. Support and evolve lab hardware and software development initiatives. Assist developers in debugging production issues.Student Mentoring', "Assist in technical writing tasks and administrative functions of proposal preparation and submission. Keep track of upcoming due dates and solicitations that may be in accordance with the lab's research mission. Work with Drexel's research office and ECE/COE staff to coordinate proposal submission logistics.Research and Collaboration", 'Work with potential business partners to build and maintain a cooperative relationship through the entire cycle from initial meetings, cultivation of prospective research sponsors, proposal development, and progress reporting.Lab Administration', "Philadelphia, PACategories: College of Engineering, Drexel UniversityAbout DrexelDrexel is a comprehensive global research university ranked among the top 100 in the nation. With over 24,000 students, Drexel is one of America's 15 largest private universities. Drexel is one of Philadelphia's top 10 private employers, and a major engine for economic development in the region. Drexel has committed to being the nation's most civically engaged university, with community partnerships integrated into every aspect of service and academics.Job SummaryThe Post-Doctoral Researcher will be responsible for the conduct of research and helping with laboratory administration in the Drexel Wireless Systems Laboratory (DWSL). The employee will be collaborating on multiple projects with other researchers but must also be able to lead multiple technical and administrative efforts independently.Essential FunctionsSpecific job tasks include writing proposals, papers, and reports, assisting with development of a textile sensor design kit involving fabric antennas, providing a framework for the rapid design and iteration of textile-based sensors and electronics. This position interacts with other Drexel faculty, staff, and students (within or outside of the College of Engineering) on a regular basis.Business Development"]

Analytics embraces the value of a diverse workforce, and believes it is a core strength of our company that we encourage those values in every DAT employee, at every level of our organization, regardless of tenure or rank. We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.', 'DAT Solutions is seeking a Data Scientist I to join our growing Data Science team in Beaverton, Oregon.', 'Our Data Scientists are responsible for working with internal stakeholders to address a wide variety of data objectives – from traditional business intelligence to aid in the development of sophisticated models to be part of our products to addressing strategic questions, etc.\xa0', 'Experience in developing production level code in those languages.', 'What You’ll Do', 'All referrals and résumés are managed exclusively through the Human Resources Department.', 'Participate and lead team problem solving efforts and offer ideas to solve internal client issues.', 'At least 2 years of regular usage of relational databases and data structures']

job_title: Senior / Principal Cloud Security Threat Researcher
job_text: ['Depending on your level of experience and the impact you make, you may also be offered the opportiunity to fast track up to Distinguished Engineer level within your first 12 months of employment. ', '\xa0 ', 'Programming skills with      scripting languages such as Python and query languages\xa0 ', 'What Will Be Beneficial ', 'Our client are a fast growing and extremely well-funded Pre-IPO Cyber security vendor.\xa0 Due to the strong growth, they are now looking to expand their research team by hiring someone who brings strong Cloud systems focused security research experience. ', 'What You Will Need\xa0 ', '\xa0', 'What You Will Need\xa0', '5+ years direct experience in      areas of security research, malware analysis, or cloud security      architecture ', 'Senior / Principal Cloud Security Threat Researcher ', '5+ years of attack and      penetration testing experience; or 5+ years of incident response and      threat analysis experience (again, with a focus on Cloud solutions) ', 'In the role of Senior / Principal Cloud Security Threat Researcher, you will have a direct impact on the direction of the company and its cloud security solutions by researching threats / malware and helping technically shape the product direction. \xa0 ', 'Knowledge of exploitation techniques used to attack cloud platforms / systems, with the ability to think like an attacker ', ' ', ' Experience with big data      technologies such as Athena, Hadoop, Spark', ' 5+ years direct experience in      areas of security research, malware analysis, or cloud security      architecture  Strong understanding of cloud      systems (Azure / AWS / Google Cloud / Oracle Cloud etc) and security for SaaS, IaaS, PaaS solutions - with clear experience of attacking or defending these systems (from a research perspective)  5+ years of attack and      penetration testing experience; or 5+ years of incident response and      threat analysis experience (again, with a focus on Cloud solutions)  Knowledge of exploitation techniques used to attack cloud platforms / systems, with the ability to think like an attacker  Proficiency with reversing tools like standard debuggers, IDA pro, etc.  Proficiency with NTA and forensics tools such as Wireshark      and tcpdump  Programming skills with      scripting languages such as Python and query languages\xa0  ', 'Proficiency with reversing tools like standard debuggers, IDA pro, etc. ', 'Experience with big data      technologies such as Athena, Hadoop, Spark', 'Strong understanding of cloud      systems (Azure / AWS / Google Cloud / Oracle Cloud etc) and security for SaaS, IaaS, PaaS solutions - with clear experience of attacking or defending these systems (from a research perspective) ', 'What Will Be Beneficial', 'Proficiency with NTA and forensics tools such as Wireshark      and tcpdump ', 'THIS ROLE IS REMOTE, YOU CAN BE BASED ANYWHERE IN THE USA OR CANADA - BUT YOU MUST HAVE THE RIGHT TO WORK - AS OUR CLIENT ARE UNABLE TO SPONSOR VISAS CURRENTLY ']

Expertise in SQL and programming in Python or R;', '• Use data and experiment to verify hypothesis around bottlenecks in product growth, and consult on direction for improvement;', '• Work with engineers and product stakeholders to deliver product insights.', 'Recommendation algorithm team plays a central role in the company, driving critical product decisions and platform growth. The team is made up of machine learning researchers and engineers, who support and innovate on production recommendation models and drive product impact. The team is dynamic, fast-pacing, collaborative and impact-driven.', '• Strong communication and teamwork skills.', '• Strong analytical and causal reasoning mindset, and rigidity on statistical correctness;', '• Keep track of core metrics and attribute metrics changes to root causes;', '• Master degree in statistics, econometrics, quantitative sociology or a related scientific major, with 3+ years of related work experience;', "Responsibilities - What You'II Do", '• Knowledge in basic machine learning and deep learning;', 'Apply', 'Qualifications', 'TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.', '• Analyze market dynamics, potential gain and cost of new product initiatives, and consult on product strategy;', "TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too."]

['', 'In This Role, You Will', 'Expert knowledge of a scientific computing language (such as R or Python) and SQL', 'Design, analyze, and interpret experiments', 'The ability to communicate results clearly', 'Experience working with multiple cross-functional teams to deliver results', 'We’re Looking For Someone Who Has', ' Act as an embedded partner to the Risk team, helping them to identify and answer questions with data and modeling Create analyses that tell a story focused on insights, not just data Build statistical and/or machine learning models to understand the riskiness of our customers Design, analyze, and interpret experiments Build and improve data ETL pipeline to collect new data and refine the existing data sources ', 'Prior experience in Trust & Safety, Risk or a related field', 'Act as an embedded partner to the Risk team, helping them to identify and answer questions with data and modeling', 'Build and improve data ETL pipeline to collect new data and refine the existing data sources', 'Build statistical and/or machine learning models to understand the riskiness of our customers', '5+ years experience working with and analyzing large data sets to solve problems and drive impact', ' 5+ years experience working with and analyzing large data sets to solve problems and drive impact A PhD or MS in a quantitative field (e.g., Operations Research, Economics, Statistics, Sciences, Engineering) Expert knowledge of a scientific computing language (such as R or Python) and SQL Strong knowledge of statistics and experimentation Experience working with multiple cross-functional teams to deliver results The ability to communicate results clearly ', 'Nice To Haves', 'Strong knowledge of statistics and experimentation', 'A PhD or MS in a quantitative field (e.g., Operations Research, Economics, Statistics, Sciences, Engineering)', ' Prior experience in Trust & Safety, Risk or a related field', 'Create analyses that tell a story focused on insights, not just data']

['', 'Determine new ways to improve data and search quality, and predictive capabilities.', 'Produce quantitative and qualitative modeling of business dynamics, user behavior, etc.', 'Relationship Management Trusted by staff, peers, and stakeholder groups; Balances concern for productivity and results with sensitivity for employees’ needs/problems; Approachable and friendly; Handles difficult situations constructively and tactfully.', 'Stakeholder Focus Maintains positive and collaborative connection to key stakeholders. Understands needs, goals and objectives of all constituent groups. Works to create, monitor, and exceed key metrics and targets in support of key groups.', 'Develop prototypes, proof of concepts, algorithms, predictive models, and custom analysis.', 'Apply various data science methods to understanding the most important aspects of our product, users, and business.', 'Required Skills And Experiences', '5+ years of professional industry experience doing quantitative analysis. An advanced degree (MS, PhD) in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Economics, Physics) a plus.', 'You are an advocate for the business You have a deep passion for understanding the key challenges in our industry, and our business. You are fascinated by the subjects that will have the greatest impact, not the problems in themselves. You want to turn data insights into real solutions that impact the business and our customers.', 'Self-Starter We’re a fast-paced team that likes to think outside the box, so dig in to never-been-done-before projects, and figure out who can best help you execute. ', 'Experience working with data technologies that allow effective storage and analysis of large amounts of data - (e.g. Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Presto, S3, etc)', 'SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST', 'You love to collaborate You work across functions (product, marketing, support, and engineering) to turn data and ideas into meaning for our users. You involve others throughout the data research and analysis life cycle and make it easy for them to participate in this process. You share and collaborate on your ideas and concepts with your peers, engineers, and other team members to solicit feedback early and often.', 'Evangelizing evidence-based decision making by partnering with key decision makers and driving general accessibility of data and insights.', 'We love diversity, but these are some of the characteristics that thrive in this role.', 'Hello Alice is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that will consider all qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.', 'You make efficient predictions You have a broad knowledge of algorithms to select the right one, and moreover, know which features to adjust to best feed the model. You know how to combine different data so they complement each other. As a data scientist, you will champion processes that enable teams to use data in their work while staying nimble.', 'Who We’re Looking For', 'Expert in designing and testing experiments.', ' You can communicate effectively with business users The reality is that statistics are complex and difficult to understand. You understand how to go beyond the spreadsheet to craft a story that conveys your results persuasively, to anyone. This can range from the most mundane (Powerpoint presentation) to the most exotic (multimedia storytelling using interactive Javascript visualizations based on the latest D3 framework). You love to collaborate You work across functions (product, marketing, support, and engineering) to turn data and ideas into meaning for our users. You involve others throughout the data research and analysis life cycle and make it easy for them to participate in this process. You share and collaborate on your ideas and concepts with your peers, engineers, and other team members to solicit feedback early and often. You are an advocate for the business You have a deep passion for understanding the key challenges in our industry, and our business. You are fascinated by the subjects that will have the greatest impact, not the problems in themselves. You want to turn data insights into real solutions that impact the business and our customers. You make efficient predictions You have a broad knowledge of algorithms to select the right one, and moreover, know which features to adjust to best feed the model. You know how to combine different data so they complement each other. As a data scientist, you will champion processes that enable teams to use data in their work while staying nimble. You can work on a mass scale You know how to handle multi-terabyte datasets to build a robust model that holds up in production. You have a good idea of computation time, what can be done in memory and what, on the other hand, requires Hadoop and MapReduce. Self-Starter We’re a fast-paced team that likes to think outside the box, so dig in to never-been-done-before projects, and figure out who can best help you execute.  Data-Driven Problem Solver Synthesize complex or diverse information, then use intuition and experience to design the right workflow and solution. You won’t always be right, but you’ll apply those learnings going forward. Default to Action Time is of the essence as work to solve the barriers for our business owners, so our team prioritizes quick decisions based on sound judgment. It’s also how we learn quickly, gather the right information, and refine our solutions. Respect, Always Building a business is an emotional experience, so it’s important to always respond promptly and kindly to our small business owners. Actively solicit owner feedback, and anticipate their needs by getting to know them and their communities. Internally, our team communicates often, respectfully challenges one another to build the best outcomes, and works as a collaborative team to leverage our unique strengths. Professional, but Human Write clearly and informatively, edit always for spelling and grammar, present numerical data effectively, and show up on time, with a prepared agenda. Lead the team, no matter your position, and exemplify the hard work and grit exhibited by the small business community we support. We’re also human, so we believe in enjoying the journey and keeping it fun. There’s always a place for kind-hearted humor and witty observations. Creative Planning Develop workable implementation plans that leverage the wealth of resources available to our team. Create actionable, detailed road maps that elevate Hello Alice and push the boundaries of what we are capable of accomplishing both as a business and for the owners we support.  Be Scrappy We operate with an entrepreneurial mindset, testing and iterating, and starting with small budgets to prove our theories. Every team member contributes to profits and revenue, and is responsible for optimizing organizational resources, whether it’s time, money, or energy. We love to do a lot with a little, but aren’t afraid to invest when an idea shows traction. Stakeholder Focus Maintains positive and collaborative connection to key stakeholders. Understands needs, goals and objectives of all constituent groups. Works to create, monitor, and exceed key metrics and targets in support of key groups. Relationship Management Trusted by staff, peers, and stakeholder groups; Balances concern for productivity and results with sensitivity for employees’ needs/problems; Approachable and friendly; Handles difficult situations constructively and tactfully. ', 'You can communicate effectively with business users The reality is that statistics are complex and difficult to understand. You understand how to go beyond the spreadsheet to craft a story that conveys your results persuasively, to anyone. This can range from the most mundane (Powerpoint presentation) to the most exotic (multimedia storytelling using interactive Javascript visualizations based on the latest D3 framework).', 'Role And Responsibilities', 'Organizing disparate facts and findings into powerful narratives that have the broadest possible application within Hello Alice.', 'Summary', 'Creative Planning Develop workable implementation plans that leverage the wealth of resources available to our team. Create actionable, detailed road maps that elevate Hello Alice and push the boundaries of what we are capable of accomplishing both as a business and for the owners we support. ', "Provide research on topics including Hello Alice's business model and recommendation techniques.", 'Respect, Always Building a business is an emotional experience, so it’s important to always respond promptly and kindly to our small business owners. Actively solicit owner feedback, and anticipate their needs by getting to know them and their communities. Internally, our team communicates often, respectfully challenges one another to build the best outcomes, and works as a collaborative team to leverage our unique strengths.', ' 5+ years of professional industry experience doing quantitative analysis. An advanced degree (MS, PhD) in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Economics, Physics) a plus. Productivity Tools - Email, Microsoft Office or equivalent Agile Tools - Trello, Jira, or TFS Expert in at least one programming language for data analysis - (e.g. Python, R, MATLAB, pandas) Experience working with data technologies that allow effective storage and analysis of large amounts of data - (e.g. Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Presto, S3, etc) Expert in designing and testing experiments. ', 'Be Scrappy We operate with an entrepreneurial mindset, testing and iterating, and starting with small budgets to prove our theories. Every team member contributes to profits and revenue, and is responsible for optimizing organizational resources, whether it’s time, money, or energy. We love to do a lot with a little, but aren’t afraid to invest when an idea shows traction.', 'You can work on a mass scale You know how to handle multi-terabyte datasets to build a robust model that holds up in production. You have a good idea of computation time, what can be done in memory and what, on the other hand, requires Hadoop and MapReduce.', 'About Hello Alice', 'Agile Tools - Trello, Jira, or TFS', 'Here’s what you’ll be working on day-to-day, but as a nimble organization that puts our small business community at the forefront, flexibility is key, and other responsibilities may arise. ', 'Data-Driven Problem Solver Synthesize complex or diverse information, then use intuition and experience to design the right workflow and solution. You won’t always be right, but you’ll apply those learnings going forward.', " Apply various data science methods to understanding the most important aspects of our product, users, and business. Organizing disparate facts and findings into powerful narratives that have the broadest possible application within Hello Alice. Evangelizing evidence-based decision making by partnering with key decision makers and driving general accessibility of data and insights. Design and build data set processes for modeling, data mining, and production purposes. Determine new ways to improve data and search quality, and predictive capabilities. Perform and interpret data studies and product experiments concerning new data sources or new uses for existing data sources. Develop prototypes, proof of concepts, algorithms, predictive models, and custom analysis. Provide research on topics including Hello Alice's business model and recommendation techniques. Produce quantitative and qualitative modeling of business dynamics, user behavior, etc. ", 'Design and build data set processes for modeling, data mining, and production purposes.', 'Expert in at least one programming language for data analysis - (e.g. Python, R, MATLAB, pandas)', 'Perform and interpret data studies and product experiments concerning new data sources or new uses for existing data sources.', 'Professional, but Human Write clearly and informatively, edit always for spelling and grammar, present numerical data effectively, and show up on time, with a prepared agenda. Lead the team, no matter your position, and exemplify the hard work and grit exhibited by the small business community we support. We’re also human, so we believe in enjoying the journey and keeping it fun. There’s always a place for kind-hearted humor and witty observations.', 'Productivity Tools - Email, Microsoft Office or equivalent', 'Default to Action Time is of the essence as work to solve the barriers for our business owners, so our team prioritizes quick decisions based on sound judgment. It’s also how we learn quickly, gather the right information, and refine our solutions.', 'Experience with statistical and machine learning methods to build descriptive and predictive models.']

job_title: Statistical Data Scientist, Quantitative Medicine Sciences
job_text: ['', "leverage statistics and predictive modeling techniques including machine learning to evolve model-based drug development within key therapeutic areas (Parkinson’s, Alzheimer’s, Crohn's, Neonatal, Infectious, etc.)", 'Background', 'Responsibilities/Experience:', 'great technical, presentation, and communication skills', 'leverage machine learning, NLP, and deep learning on clinical patient data that provide insights into disease: progression, evolution, and prevention', 'must have a PhD in a quantitative discipline', 'must have a PhD in a quantitative disciplinemust have strong Statistics background including predictive modeling and machine learningproficiency with Python or R\xa0great technical, presentation, and communication skillshealthcare analytics is highly desired', 'this is a senior individual contributor role that is both hands-on analytics and strategic\xa0', 'Background: Nonprofit neutral third party that develops artificial intelligence (AI) solutions to accelerate drug development seeks a Data Scientist to join its Quantitative Medicine Sciences group. Data Scientist will leverage applied statistics and machine learning to evolve many patient initiatives.', 'What Will You Do:', 'use statistical quantitative methods to analyze clinical sensor data and provide insights on disease progression', 'proficiency with Python or R\xa0', 'apply machine learning and statistics to generate synthetic data used to solve complex disease scenarios', 'More Info:', 'healthcare analytics is highly desired', 'provide statistical machine learning support to regulatory agencies on critical findings on analysis performed', "leverage statistics and predictive modeling techniques including machine learning to evolve model-based drug development within key therapeutic areas (Parkinson’s, Alzheimer’s, Crohn's, Neonatal, Infectious, etc.)use statistical quantitative methods to analyze clinical sensor data and provide insights on disease progressionleverage machine learning, NLP, and deep learning on clinical patient data that provide insights into disease: progression, evolution, and preventionapply machine learning and statistics to generate synthetic data used to solve complex disease scenariosprovide statistical machine learning support to regulatory agencies on critical findings on analysis performed", 'must have strong Statistics background including predictive modeling and machine learning', 'this is a senior individual contributor role that is both hands-on analytics and strategic\xa0relocation to the Tucson, AZ provided, can be REMOTE for experienced candidates, visa OK', 'relocation to the Tucson, AZ provided, can be REMOTE for experienced candidates, visa OK', 'Ping Me: sunil@analyticrecruiting.com']

job_title: Research Scientist - Center for Childhood Deafness, Language, and Learning
job_text: ['', 'Required Qualifications', 'About Boys Town', ' All scientists will have access to new, state-of-the art laboratory facilities, generous start-up funds, and extensive supports for grant management, IT, participant recruitment, and clinical measurement. ', ' Boys Town National Research Hospital (BTNRH) is seeking Junior, Mid, or Senior career level Research Scientists in the Center for Childhood Deafness, Language & Learning (CCDLL). The Center for Childhood Deafness, Language, and Learning is directed by Karla McGregor, Ph.D. ', ' All scientists will have access to new, state-of-the art laboratory facilities, generous start-up funds, and extensive supports for grant management, IT, participant recruitment, and clinical measurement.  Senior scientists aim for 50% salary support on external grants. Via participation in the Center for Perception and Communication in Children (CPCC) funded by a Centers of Biomedical Research Excellence (COBRE) grant, junior scientists are provided with extensive mentoring and three years of full support to enable them to reach this goal. Via participation in the Center for Perception and Communication in Children (CPCC) funded by a Centers of Biomedical Research Excellence (COBRE) grant, junior scientists are provided with extensive mentoring and three years of full support to enable them to reach this goal.Scientists at Boys Town National Research Hospital have the advantage of working alongside an outstanding, internationally recognized group of colleagues. In addition to clinicians and scientists in the CCDLL, collaborations are possible with faculty in the Centers for Human Neurosciences, Neurobehavioral Research, Sensory Neuroscience Research, Audiological and Vestibular Services, and Hearing Research. Our intellectual community also includes colleagues at the University of Nebraska-Omaha, the University of Nebraska-Lincoln, the University of Nebraska Medical Center, Creighton University and the Creighton University School of Medicine. Our participation in the Great Plains IDeA-Clinical & Translational Research Center provides training opportunities, partnerships, and resources for scientists who wish to translate science into better health outcomes.Required Qualifications : A successful candidate will have a Ph.D. as well as post-doctoral studies or faculty-level experience in Speech-Language Pathology, Cognitive Science, Developmental or Experimental Psychology or a related field, and a record that demonstrates a highly productive and excellent research program. Expertise in phonological development or disorders, neurodevelopmental disorders, or the interface between language development and emotional/behavioral health is of particular interest, but not required.About Boys Town : Boys Town has been changing the way America cares for children and families since 1917. Our employees have helped us grow from a small boardinghouse in downtown Omaha, Nebraska into one of the largest national child and family care organizations in the country. With the addition of Boys Town National Research Hospital in 1977, our services branched out into the health care and research fields, offering even more career opportunities to those looking to make a real difference.Our employees are our #1 supporters when it comes to achieving Boys Towns mission, which is why we are proud of their commitment to making the world a better place for children, families, patients, and communities. Unique perks to Boys Town employees and their families include free visits to Boys Town physicians and free prescriptions under the Boys Town Medical Plan, tuition assistance, parenting resources from our experts and professional development opportunities within the organization, just to name a few. Working at Boys Town is more than just a job, it is a way of life.Date Posted : September 23, 2020Boys Town National Research Hospital is a tobacco free campus. This advertisement describes the general nature of work to be performed and does not include an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, or abilities required. Boys Town is an equal employment opportunity employer and participates in the E-Verify program. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. To request a disability-related accommodation in the application process, contact us at 1-877-639-6003.', ' Senior scientists aim for 50% salary support on external grants. Via participation in the Center for Perception and Communication in Children (CPCC) funded by a Centers of Biomedical Research Excellence (COBRE) grant, junior scientists are provided with extensive mentoring and three years of full support to enable them to reach this goal. Via participation in the Center for Perception and Communication in Children (CPCC) funded by a Centers of Biomedical Research Excellence (COBRE) grant, junior scientists are provided with extensive mentoring and three years of full support to enable them to reach this goal.Scientists at Boys Town National Research Hospital have the advantage of working alongside an outstanding, internationally recognized group of colleagues. Our intellectual community also includes colleagues at the University of Nebraska-Omaha, the University of Nebraska-Lincoln, the University of Nebraska Medical Center, Creighton University and the Creighton University School of Medicine. Expertise in phonological development or disorders, neurodevelopmental disorders, or the interface between language development and emotional/behavioral health is of particular interest, but not required.About Boys Town : Boys Town has been changing the way America cares for children and families since 1917. ['', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Perform validation of the production pipeline and document the validation results for regulatory purposes.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa01-2 years working in industry in a regulated environment, preferably in a clinical diagnostic laboratory', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Familiarity with open source bioinformatics tools and high-level programming skills (eg Python, R)', 'We are seeking a highly motivated\xa0Scientist, Bioinformatics Operations\xa0to join our Data Sciences team in Cambridge, MA.\xa0The Scientist will work closely with lab operations, product development and technology teams to oversee execution, validation and documentation of the production bioinformatics pipeline. The successful candidate will have knowledge of NGS methods development, strong analytical and technical skills and solid scientific background.', 'At Thrive, we are motivated to change the face of a cancer diagnosis. We challenge the status quo and are willing to think differently. Our curiosity drives us. There are countless questions related to cancer, and we flourish by finding solutions. We know what we do is important, and we take our work seriously. We also have fun. We do our work with vibrant energy, and we laugh out loud at the little things. This is How We Thrive.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Familiarity with version control systems and other software processes', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Self-motivated, with strong organizational skills, attention to detail and an ability to adapt to increasing opportunities and responsibilities as our team rapidly grows', '\xa0', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Develop methods to improve production process and debug and document process deviations. Create and maintain SOPs and other process documents.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Develop QC metrics relevant for analysis of production runs. Build queries, visualizations and reports from the patient sample data to share with cross functional teams.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience with cloud based development', 'Requirements and Qualifications', 'The Role', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Masters or equivalent with deep technical experience in bioinformatics and NGS data analysis', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Provide general bioinformatics support to the lab operations team.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Perform quality control analysis on data from multi-omics assays.', 'A cancer diagnosis is something no one wants to hear. Too often, cancer is detected late, once it has spread and treatment options are limited. But cancer can be more effectively treated with an intent to cure if caught in the earlier stages. At Thrive, an Exact Sciences Company, our goal is to transform this outlook: to catch cancer earlier, including several with no screening options today, to improve patient outcomes. We are developing a blood-based test that is designed to be affordable and utilized as part of routine medical care to detect multiple types of cancer at earlier stages. Our approach goes beyond a cancer diagnosis. We are developing a platform that will serve as a resource to help patients and their families maneuver the often confusing and overwhelming path that follows a cancer diagnosis.', 'Primary Responsibilities', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Develop a deep understanding of production bioinformatics pipeline and analyze any unexpected findings from the pipeline in patient sample data.']

job_title: Data Scientist - Deep/Machine Learning Algorithms (4-8 yrs) Metros/Anywhere in India/Multiple Locations (Analytics & Data Science)
job_text: ['', ' Experience using Data Science platforms such as Dataiku and RapidMiner is Advantage.', ' Experience in building and scaling models for time series (such as sensors etc.).', ' Solid understanding of Statistics, Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Artificial Intelligence Technologies.', ' Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases and Hadoop based platforms.', ' Familiarity with agile execution of data science projects', ' 4+ years of total experience with recent & relevant experience as a data scientist.', 'Job Requirements', ' Experience in building and scaling models related to Anomaly Detection and Failure Prediction, utilizing various algorithmic constructs such as Decision trees, SVMs, random forest, gradient boosted trees, artificial neural networks (MLP), LSTMs/GRUs, Auto encoders-decoders, Regression (Linear as well as Non-linear), etc.', ' 4+ years of total experience with recent & relevant experience as a data scientist. Solid understanding of Statistics, Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Artificial Intelligence Technologies. Experience using Data Science platforms such as Dataiku and RapidMiner is Advantage. Experience in building and scaling models for time series (such as sensors etc.). Experience in building and scaling models related to Anomaly Detection and Failure Prediction, utilizing various algorithmic constructs such as Decision trees, SVMs, random forest, gradient boosted trees, artificial neural networks (MLP), LSTMs/GRUs, Auto encoders-decoders, Regression (Linear as well as Non-linear), etc. Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases and Hadoop based platforms. Familiarity with agile execution of data science projects']
